ржЫрзЗрж▓рзЗ ржкржбрж╝рж╛рж╢рзБржирзЛрзЯ рждрзЛ ржнрж╛рж▓ржЗ, ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржЧрзЛрж▓ржЯрж╛ ржмрж╛ржзрж▓ ржарж┐ржХ ржорзНржпрж╛ржЯрзНрж░рж┐ржХ ржкрж░рзАржХрзНрж╖рж╛ ржжрзЗржУрзЯрж╛рж░ рждрж┐ржи ржорж╛рж╕ ржЖржЧрзЗред рж╕рзНржХрзБрж▓ ржерзЗржХрзЗ рждрж╛ржбрж╝рж┐рзЯрзЗ ржжрзЗржУрзЯрж╛ рж╣рж▓ рж╣рзЗржоржирзНржд ржорзБржЦрзЛржкрж╛ржзрзНржпрж╛рзЯржХрзЗ!
рждрж╛рж░ ржорзВрж▓рзЗржУ ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржУржЗ ржЧрж╛ржи! ржЯрж┐ржлрж┐ржи ржЯрж╛ржЗржорзЗ ржЕржирзНржпрж░рж╛ рж╕ржм ржЦрж╛рзЯ-ржжрж╛рзЯред ржХрж╛рж▓рж┐ржжрж╛рж╕ржмрж╛ржмрзБрж░ ржорзЗржЬржЫрзЗрж▓рзЗрж░ ржирж╛ ржЖржЫрзЗ ржмрж╛ржбрж╝рж┐рж░ ржжрзЗржУрзЯрж╛ ржЯрж┐ржлрж┐ржи, ржирж╛ ржкржХрзЗржЯрзЗ ржХрж╛ржирж╛ржХржбрж╝рж┐ред ржмржирзНржзрзБржжрзЗрж░ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ рж╕рзЗ ржЯрзЗржмрж┐рж▓ ржмрж╛ржЬрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржЧрж╛ржи ржЧрж╛рзЯред ржкржЩрзНржХржЬ ржорж▓рзНрж▓рж┐ржХ, рж╢ржЪрзАржи ржжрзЗржмржмрж░рзНржоржирзЗрж░ рж░рзЗржХрж░рзНржбрзЗрж░ ржЧрж╛ржиред  рждрж╛рждрзЗ ржПржоржи рж╣ржЗржЪржЗ, рж╣ржЯрзНржЯржЧрзЛрж▓ рж░рзЗржЬрж┐рж╕рзНржЯрж╛рж░ ржерзЗржХрзЗ ржирж╛ржо ржХрзЗржЯрзЗ ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржмрж▓рж╛ рж╣рж▓тАФ тАШтАШржпрж╛ржУ, ржП ржмрж╛рж░ ржЧрж╛ржи ржЧрзЗрзЯрзЗ ржмрзЗржбрж╝рж╛ржУ ржЧрзЗ ржпрж╛ржУредтАЩ

ржлрж╛ржЗржирж╛рж▓ ржкрж░рзАржХрзНрж╖рж╛рж░ ржмрж╛ржХрж┐ рждржЦржи рж╕ржмрзЗ рждрж┐ржи ржорж╛рж╕! ржХрж╛рж▓рж┐ржжрж╛рж╕ржмрж╛ржмрзБ рж╕рзНржХрзБрж▓рзЗ ржЧрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржкрзНрж░рж╛рзЯ рж╣рж╛рждрзЗ-ржкрж╛рзЯрзЗ ржзрж░рзЗ рж╕рзЗ-ржпрж╛рждрзНрж░рж╛рзЯ ржЫрзЗрж▓рзЗржХрзЗ рж░ржХрзНрж╖рж╛ ржХрж░рзЗржиред ржПрж░ ржкрж░ржУ ржпржЦржи ржлрж╛рж░рзНрж╕рзНржЯ ржбрж┐ржнрж┐рж╢ржи ржкрзЗрж▓ ржЫрзЗрж▓рзЗ, ржЦрзБржм ржЪрзЗрзЯрзЗржЫрж┐рж▓рзЗржи ржЗржЮрзНржЬрж┐ржирж┐рзЯрж╛рж░ рж╣рзЛржХред ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ рждржд ржжрж┐ржирзЗ ржЧрж╛ржи ржпрзЗ рждрж╛ржХрзЗ ржкрзЗрзЯрзЗ ржмрж╕рзЗржЫрзЗ!
ржмржирзНржзрзБ рж╕рзБржнрж╛рж╖ ржЕрж╕рж┐рждржмрж░ржгржХрзЗ ржзрж░рзЗ рж░рзЗржбрж┐рзЯрзЛрзЯ ржЕржбрж┐рж╢ржирзЗрж░ ржмрзНржпржмрж╕рзНржерж╛ ржХрж░рзЗ ржлрзЗрж▓рж▓рзЗржиред ржЕржнрж┐ржирзЗрждрж╛ ржЕрж╕рж┐рждржмрж░ржг рждржЦржи рж░рзЗржбрж┐рзЯрзЛрзЯ рждржмрж▓рж╛ ржмрж╛ржЬрж╛ржиред
ржЕржбрж┐рж╢ржирзЗ ржкрж╛рж╢ ржХрж░рж╛рж░ рждрж┐ржи ржорж╛рж╕ ржмрж╛ржжрзЗ ржкрзНрж░рзЛржЧрзНрж░рж╛ржорзЗрж░ ржЪрж┐ржарж┐ ржПрж▓ред ржЧрж╛ржи рж╢рзБржирзЗ ржкрж╛рж╣рж╛ржбрж╝рзА рж╕рж╛ржирзНржпрж╛рж▓ ржмрж▓рж▓рзЗржи, тАШтАШржмрж╛рж╣рзН, ржЪрж░рзНржЪрж╛ ржХрж░рж▓рзЗ ржнрж╛рж▓ ржЧрж╛ржЗрзЯрзЗ рж╣ржмрзЗредтАЩтАЩ ржкржЩрзНржХржЬ ржорж▓рзНрж▓рж┐ржХ ржПржХ ржжрж┐ржи ржЖржХрж╛рж╢ржмрж╛ржгрзАрждрзЗ ржЕржирзБржЬ рж╣рзЗржоржирзНрждржХрзЗ ржжрзЗржЦрзЗ ржмрж▓рж▓рзЗржи, тАШтАШрждрзБржорж┐ рждрзЛ ржжрзЗржЦржЫрж┐ ржЖржорж╛ржжрзЗрж░ ржнрж╛ржд ржорж╛рж░ржмрзЗ!тАЩтАЩ
ржЗрж╝ржЮрзНржЬрж┐ржирж┐рзЯрж╛рж░рж┐ржВржЯрж╛ рж╣рж▓ ржирж╛ред ржмрж╛ржмрж╛ ржжрзБржГржЦ ржкрзЗрзЯрзЗржЫрж┐рж▓рзЗржи, рждржмрзБ тАЩрзйрзо рж╕рж╛рж▓рзЗ ржХрж▓рзЗржЬрзЗ ржЗрж╕рзНрждржлрж╛ ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржмрж╕рж▓ ржЫрзЗрж▓рзЗред
ржПржЗ рж╕ржорзЯржХрж╛рж▓, рждрж╛рж░ ржЕрж▓рзНржк ржЖржЧрзЗ ржкрж░рзЗ рж╣рзЗржоржирзНржд ржорзБржЦрзЛржкрж╛ржзрзНржпрж╛рзЯрзЗрж░ ржЧрж╛ржирзЗрж░ ржЬрзАржмржирзЗ ржПржХрзЗрж░ ржкрж░ ржПржХ ржШржЯржирж╛ ржШржЯрждрзЗ ржерж╛ржХрж▓ред ржмрзЗрж╢ ржХрзЯрзЗржХржЯрж┐ рж░ржмрзАржирзНржжрзНрж░рж╕ржЩрзНржЧрзАрждрзЗрж░ рж░рзЗржХрж░рзНржб ржмрзЗрж░рж▓ред рж░рзЗржбрж┐рзЯрзЛ ржерзЗржХрзЗржУ ржШржи ржШржи ржбрж╛ржХред тАШржорж╣рж╛рж▓рзЯрж╛тАЩред ржЖржЗржкрж┐ржЯрж┐ржПред рж╕рж▓рж┐рж▓ ржЪрзМржзрзБрж░рзАред ржкрзНрж░ржержо ржкрзНрж▓рзЗ-ржмрзНржпрж╛ржХред 
ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ рждрж╛рж░ ржкрж░рзЗржУ ржпрзЗ ржЦрзБржм рж╕рзБржжрж┐ржи ржЪрж▓ржЫрж┐рж▓ рж╕ржВрж╕рж╛рж░рзЗ, рждрзЗржоржи рж╣рзЯрждрзЛ ржирзЯред ржЕрж░рзНржерзЗрж░ ржХрж╛рж░ржгрзЗржЗ ржмрж╣рзБ ржжрж┐ржи ржкрж░рзНржпржирзНржд ржЧрж╛ржирзЗрж░ ржЯрж┐ржЙрж╢рж╛ржирж┐ ржЫрж╛ржбрж╝рждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░рзЗржиржирж┐ред ржмрж╛ржБржзрж╛ рж░рзЛржЬржЧрж╛рж░рзЗрж░ ржЬржирзНржп ржЧрзНрж░рж╛ржорж╛ржлрзЛржи ржХрзЛржорзНржкрж╛ржирж┐рж░ рж░рж┐рж╣рж╛рж░рзНрж╕рж╛рж▓ рж░рзБржорзЗ ржЧрж╛ржирзЗрж░ ржХрзНрж▓рж╛рж╕ ржирж┐рждрзЗржиред ржмрж▓рждрзЗржи, тАШтАШржЯрж┐ржЙрж╢ржирж┐ ржирж╛ ржХрж░рж▓рзЗ ржЦрж╛ржм ржХрзА?тАЩтАЩ
тАЩрзкрзл рж╕рж╛рж▓рзЗ ржмрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржХрж░рж▓рзЗржи ржмрзЗрж▓рж╛ ржорзБржЦрзЛржкрж╛ржзрзНржпрж╛рзЯржХрзЗред рж╕рзНрждрзНрж░рзА, ржкрж╛ржБржЪ-ржкрж╛ржБржЪржЯрж┐ ржирж╛ржмрж╛рж▓ржХ рж╢рзНржпрж╛рж▓ржХ-рж╢рзНржпрж╛рж▓рж┐ржХрж╛ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ ржирждрзБржи рж╕ржВрж╕рж╛рж░ ржкрж╛рждрж▓рзЗржи ржЗржирзНржжрзНрж░ рж░рж╛рзЯ рж░рзЛржбрзЗрж░ ржнрж╛ржбрж╝рж╛ ржмрж╛ржбрж╝рж┐рждрзЗред тАЩрзкрзн-ржП ржкрзНрж░ржержо рж╕ржирзНрждрж╛ржи, ржЬрзЯржирзНрждред тАЩрзлрзк-рждрзЗ рж░рж╛ржгрзБред
ржжрж┐ржи ржХрждржХ ржЖржЧрзЗ ржХрж▓ржХрж╛рждрж╛рзЯ ржПрж╕рзЗ ржЬрзЯржирзНржд ржмрж▓ржЫрж┐рж▓рзЗржи, тАШтАШрж░рж╛ржгрзБ ржарж┐ржХ ржорждрзЛ ржЧрж╛ржиржЯрж╛ ржЧрж╛ржЗрж▓ ржирж╛ ржмрж▓рзЗ ржмрж╛ржмрж╛рж░ ржЦрзБржм ржжрзБржГржЦ ржЫрж┐рж▓ред ржмрж┐рж╢рзЗрж╖ ржХрж░рзЗ рж╢рзНрж░рж╛ржмржирзНрждрзА ржоржЬрзБржоржжрж╛рж░рзЗрж░ рж╕ржЩрзНржЧрзЗ ржбрзБрзЯрзЗржЯ тАШржЖрзЯ ржЦрзБржХрзБ ржЖрзЯтАЩ ржЧрж╛ржиржЯрж╛ рж░рж╛ржгрзБрж░ржЗ ржХрж░рж╛рж░ ржХржерж╛ ржЫрж┐рж▓ред ржмрж╛рж▓рж╕рж╛рж░рж╛ржЬрж┐ рж░рж╛ржгрзБрж░ ржХржерж╛ ржнрзЗржмрзЗржЗ ржЧрж╛ржиржЯрж╛ ржХржорзНржкрзЛржЬ ржХрж░рзЗржЫрж┐рж▓рзЗржиред ржоржирзЗ ржЖржЫрзЗ, тАШржорж╛рж╕рзБржотАЩ ржЫржмрж┐рж░ ржЧрж╛ржи тАШржирж╛ржирзА рждрзЗрж░рж┐тАЩ-рж░ рж╢рзЗрж╖ ржЕржирзНрждрж░рж╛ржЯрж╛ ржЧрж╛ржбрж╝рж┐рждрзЗ ржмрж╛ржмрж╛ ржХрзА ржпрждрзНржирзЗ рж░рж╛ржгрзБржХрзЗ рж╢рзЗржЦрж╛рждрзЗ рж╢рзЗржЦрж╛рждрзЗ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ ржпрж╛ржЪрзНржЫрзЗ рж░рзЗржХрж░рзНржб ржХрж░рж╛рждрзЗред рж░рж╛ржгрзБржХрзЗ ржирж╛ ржкрзЗрзЯрзЗ ржлрж┐ржорзЗрж▓ ржнрзЯрзЗрж╕-ржПрж░ ржЬржирзНржп ржХржмрж┐рждрж╛ ржХрзГрж╖рзНржгржорзВрж░рзНрждрж┐ржХрзЗ ржирзЗрзЯред ржХржмрж┐рждрж╛рж░ ржЖрж╕рж▓ ржирж╛ржо ржЫрж┐рж▓ рж╕рж╛рж░ржжрж╛ред ржмрж╛ржмрж╛ржЗ ржУржХрзЗ ржХржмрж┐рждрж╛ ржирж╛ржо ржжрзЗрзЯред ржмрж╛ржмрж╛рж░ рж╕ржЩрзНржЧрзЗ ржУ ржирж╛ржирж╛ ржЬрж╛рзЯржЧрж╛рзЯ ржЧрж╛ржЗрждрзЗ ржпрзЗрждред ржкрж░рзЗ ржорж╛ржирзНржирж╛ ржжрзЗтАЩржУ ржмрж╛ржмрж╛рж░ ржХрж╛ржЫ ржерзЗржХрзЗ ржУржХрзЗ ржкрзНрж░рзЛржЧрзНрж░рж╛ржо ржХрж░рждрзЗ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ ржпрзЗрждредтАЩтАЩ
ржЬрзЯржирзНрждрж░ ржХрж╛ржЫрзЗ рж╢рзЛржирж╛ ржЧрзЗрж▓, рж╣рзЗржоржирзНржд ржорзБржЦрзЛржкрж╛ржзрзНржпрж╛рзЯрзЗрж░ ржкрзНрж░ржержо рж╣рж┐ржирзНржжрж┐ ржЫржмрж┐ тАШржмрж┐рж╢ рж╕рж╛рж▓ ржмрж╛ржжтАЩ-ржПрж░ ржирзЗржкржерзНржп-ржЧрж▓рзНржкред ржЫржмрж┐ржЯрж┐ ржирж╛ржХрж┐ рждрзИрж░рж┐ рж╣рзЯрзЗржЫрж┐рж▓ тАШржбрж╛рж▓ржбрж╛тАЩрж░ рж╕ржмржЪрзЗрзЯрзЗ ржмржбрж╝ ржмржбрж╝ ржбрж╛ржмрзНржмрж╛рзЯ ржЬржорж╛ржирзЛ ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛ ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗ! рзз рж▓рж╛ржЦ рзнрзл рж╣рж╛ржЬрж╛рж░ ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛! рж╕рзЗржЗ тАЩрзмрзж-тАЩрзмрзз рж╕рж╛рж▓рзЗ ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛ржЯрж╛ ржирзЗрж╣рж╛ржд ржХржо ржирзЯред

ржПржЗ рж╕ржорзЯрзЗрж░ ржарж┐ржХ ржЖржЧрзЗ ржЫтАЩржорж╛рж╕ ржЧрж╛ржи ржЧрж╛ржУрзЯрж╛ ржмржирзНржз рж░рзЗржЦрзЗржЫрж┐рж▓рзЗржи рж▓рждрж╛ ржоржЩрзНржЧрзЗрж╢ржХрж░ред ржЧрж▓рж╛рзЯ ржХрзА ржПржХржЯрж╛ ржЕрж╕рзБржмрж┐ржзрзЗрж░ ржЬржирзНржп ржЧрж╛ржЗрждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░ржЫрж┐рж▓рзЗржи ржирж╛ред ржнрзЗржмрзЗ ржмрж╕рзЗржЫрж┐рж▓рзЗржи, ржЖрж░ ржмрзЛржз рж╣рзЯ ржХрзЛржиржУ ржжрж┐ржи ржЧрж╛ржиржЗ ржЧрж╛ржУрзЯрж╛ рж╣ржмрзЗ ржирж╛ред
ржарж┐ржХ ржПржоржи рж╕ржорзЯржЗ рж╣рзЗржоржирзНржд ржорзБржЦрзЛржкрж╛ржзрзНржпрж╛рзЯ рждрж╛ржБржХрзЗ ржкрзНрж░рж╕рзНрждрж╛ржм ржжрзЗржи, тАШтАШржЖржорж┐ ржЫржмрж┐ ржХрж░ржЫрж┐, рждрж┐ржи ржжрж┐ржи ржмрж╛ржжрзЗ тАШржлрж┐рж▓рзНржо рж╕рзЗржирзНржЯрж╛рж░тАЩ рж╕рзНржЯрзБржбрж┐рзЯрзЛрждрзЗ рж░рзЗржХрж░рзНржбрж┐ржВред ржЖржорж┐ рждрзЛржорж╛ржХрзЗ ржЬрзЛрж░ ржХрж░ржм ржирж╛ред рждрзЛржорж╛рж░ ржЗржЪрзНржЫрзЗ рж╣рж▓рзЗ рждрзБржорж┐ ржПрж╕рзЛредтАЩтАЩ
ржПрж╕рзЗржЫрж┐рж▓рзЗржи рж▓рждрж╛ржЬрж┐ред ржЧрзЗрзЯрзЗржУржЫрж┐рж▓рзЗржиред ржЖрж░ рж╕ржорзНржорж╛ржиржжржХрзНрж╖рж┐ржгрж╛ ржжрж┐рждрзЗ ржЧрзЗрж▓рзЗ ржлрзБржБрж╕рзЗ ржЙржарзЗ ржмрж▓рзЗржЫрж┐рж▓рзЗржи, тАШтАШржжрж╛ржжрж╛, ржЖржк ржорзБржЭрзЗ ржкрзНржпрзЯрж╕рж╛ ржжрзЗ рж░рж╣рзЗржБ рж╣рзНржпрж╛рзЯ?тАЩтАЩ ржарзЗрж▓рзЗ рж╕рж░рж┐рзЯрзЗ ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗржЫрж┐рж▓рзЗржи ржЦрж╛ржоред
рж▓рждрж╛ ржоржЩрзНржЧрзЗрж╢ржХрж░-ржЖрж╢рж╛ ржнрзЛржБрж╕рж▓рзЗ ржжрзБржЬржирзЗржЗ ржХрзЛржиржУ ржжрж┐ржи ржЧрж╛ржирзЗрж░ ржЬржирзНржп рж╣рзЗржоржирзНржд ржорзБржЦрзЛржкрж╛ржзрзНржпрж╛рзЯрзЗрж░ ржХрж╛ржЫ ржерзЗржХрзЗ ржЕрж░рзНрже ржирзЗржиржирж┐ред ржЬрзЯржирзНржд ржмрж▓ржЫрж┐рж▓рзЗржи, тАШтАШржорж╛рждрзНрж░ ржжрзБтАЩржорж┐ржирж┐ржЯрзЗ ржЧрж╛ржирзЗрж░ ржорзБржЦржбрж╝рж╛ржЯрж╛ ржХрж░рзЗржЫрж┐рж▓ ржмрж╛ржмрж╛ред ржЖржорж┐ рждржЦржи ржмржЫрж░ ржЪрзЛржжрзНржжрзЛрж░ ржЫрзЗрж▓рзЗред ржПржХ ржжрж┐ржи ржжрзЗржЦрж┐, ржмрж╛ржмрж╛ тАШржХржд ржжрж┐ржи ржЧрзЗрж▓ ржХржд рж░рж╛рждтАЩ ржЧрж╛ржиржЯрж╛ ржЧрзБржи ржЧрзБржи ржХрж░рзЗ ржЧрж╛ржЗржЫрзЗред рждрж╛рж░ ржкрж░ржЗ ржЖржорж╛рзЯ ржбрзЗржХрзЗ ржмрж▓рж▓, тАШржЪрж▓ рждрзЛ ржмрж╛ржмрзБ рж╕рзБрж░ржЯрж╛ ржХрж░рж┐ред ржЖржорж┐ ржарзЗржХрж╛ ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржЧрзЗрж▓рж╛ржо рждржмрж▓рж╛рзЯред ржмрж╛ржмрж╛ ржорзБрж╣рзВрж░рзНрждрзЗ рж╕рзБрж░ ржХрж░рзЗ ржлрзЗрж▓рж▓тАФ тАШржХржБрж╣рж┐ ржжрзАржк ржЬрзНржмрж▓рзЗтАжтАЩредтАЩтАЩ

тАвтАвтАвтАвтАв
 
рзирзм ржирзЯ, рззрзпрзорзп-ржПрж░ рзирзн рж╕рзЗржкрзНржЯрзЗржорзНржмрж░ред рж╕ржХрж╛рж▓ред ржнрзЛрж░ржмрзЗрж▓рж╛ ржХрзЗржоржи ржПржХржЯрж╛ рж╣рж╛рж╣рж╛ржХрж╛рж░ ржнрзЗрждрж░ ржерзЗржХрзЗ ржарзЗрж▓рзЗ рждрзБрж▓рзЗ ржжрж┐рж▓ред рж░рзЗржбрж┐рзЯрзЛ, ржЯрж┐ржнрж┐, ржХрзНржпрж╛рж╕рзЗржЯрзЗ ржШрж░рзЗ ржШрж░рзЗ рж╣рзЗржоржирзНржд ржорзБржЦрзЛржкрж╛ржзрзНржпрж╛рзЯрзЗрж░ ржЧрж▓рж╛ ржмржбрж╝ ржнрзАрж╖ржг ржЬрзЛрж░рзЗ ржмрж╛ржЬржЫрзЗтАФ тАШрждржЦржи ржХрзЗ ржмрж▓рзЗ ржЧрзЛ рж╕рзЗржЗ ржкрзНрж░ржнрж╛рждрзЗ ржирзЗржЗ ржЖржорж┐тАЩред

ржЪрж▓рждрзЗ ржирж╛ ржЪрж╛ржУрзЯрж╛ рж╢рж░рзАрж░ржЯрж╛ржХрзЗ ржЯрзЗржирзЗ рж╣рж┐ржБржЪржбрж╝рзЗ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ ржкрзМржБржЫрж▓рж╛ржо ржорзЗржиржХрж╛ рж╕рж┐ржирзЗржорж╛рж░ ржЙрж▓рзНржЯрзЛ ржжрж┐ржХрзЗ, рждрж╛ржБрж░ ржлрзНрж▓рзНржпрж╛ржЯ ржмрж╛ржбрж╝рж┐рждрзЗред ржХрж╛рждрж╛рж░рзЗ ржХрж╛рждрж╛рж░рзЗ ржорж╛ржирзБрж╖ред
ржпрзЗ ржмрж╛ржбрж╝рж┐рждрзЗ ржХрж╛рж░ржгрзЗ-ржЕржХрж╛рж░ржгрзЗ ржЖржмрж╛рж░рж┐ржд ржжрзНржмрж╛рж░ ржкрзЗрзЯрзЗржЫрж┐, ржП ржжрж┐ржи рждрж╛-ржЗ ржЕржмрж░рзБржжрзНржз ржЬржирж╕рзНрж░рзЛрждрзЗред рждрж╛рж░ржЗ ржорж╛ржЭрзЗ ржПржХ ржЬржи ржЪрж┐ржирждрзЗ ржкрзЗрж░рзЗ ржбрзЗржХрзЗ ржирж┐рж▓рзЗржиред ржЪрж╛рж░ рждрж▓рж╛рж░ рж╣рж▓ ржШрж░ред рж╕рзЗржЦрж╛ржирзЗржУ ржорж╛ржирзБрж╖ ржЖрж░ ржорж╛ржирзБрж╖ рж╢рзБржзрзБред ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржХрж╛рж░ржУ ржжрж┐ржХрзЗ ржЪрзЛржЦ ржпрж╛ржЪрзНржЫрзЗ ржирж╛ред рж╢рзБржзрзБ ржжрзЗржЦржЫрж┐ ржЫрзЛржЯржмрзЗрж▓рж╛ ржерзЗржХрзЗ ржжрзЗржЦрж╛ рж╕рж╛ржбрж╝рзЗ ржЫтАЩржлрзБржЯ рж▓ржорзНржмрж╛ рж╕рзЗржЗ ржорж╛ржирзБрж╖ржЯрж┐ржХрзЗред ржмрж░ржлрзЗрж░ ржмрж┐ржЫрж╛ржирж╛рзЯ ржзржмржзржмрзЗ рж╕рж╛ржжрж╛ ржЪрж╛ржжрж░рзЗ ржЧрж▓рж╛ ржЕржмржзрж┐ ржврзЗржХрзЗ ржШрзБржорж┐рзЯрзЗ ржЖржЫрзЗржиред
ржЪрзЛржЦрзЗрж░ рж╕рж╛ржоржирзЗ ржнрзЗрж╕рзЗ ржЙржаржЫрж┐рж▓ рж╕рж╛ржбрж╝рзЗ ржЪрж╛рж░ ржорж╛рж╕ ржЖржЧрзЗрж░, рзк ржорзЗ рззрзпрзорзп-ржПрж░ ржмрж┐ржХрзЗрж▓ред рж╕рж╛рж╣рж┐рждрзНржпрж┐ржХ-ржмржирзНржзрзБ ржЖрж╢рзБрждрзЛрж╖ ржорзБржЦрзЛржкрж╛ржзрзНржпрж╛рзЯржХрзЗ рж╢рзЗрж╖ рж░ржУржирж╛ ржХрж░рж┐рзЯрзЗ ржжрж┐рждрзЗ ржЖрж╕рж╛, рждрж╛рж░ рж╣рж┐ржоржарж╛ржирзНржбрж╛ ржХржкрж╛рж▓рзЗ рж╣рж╛ржд рж░рзЗржЦрзЗ ржлрзБржБржкрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржУржарж╛, ржУржЗ ржорж╛ржирзБрж╖ржЯрж┐ржХрзЗред ржкрж┐рждрзГрж╣рж╛рж░рж╛ ржЖржорж╛рж░ ржкрж╛рж╢рзЗ ржжрж╛ржБржбрж╝рж┐рзЯрзЗ ржХрж╛ржирзНржирж╛ржнрзЗржЬрж╛ ржнрж╛ржЩрж╛ ржЧрж▓рж╛рзЯ ржпрж┐ржирж┐ ржмржирзНржзрзБржХрзЗ ржЬрж┐ржЬрзНржЮрзЗрж╕ ржХрж░рзЗржЫрж┐рж▓рзЗржи, тАШтАШржЖржорж╛рж░ ржмрзЗрж▓рж╛ ржХрзЗ рж╕рж┐-ржЕржл ржХрж░рждрзЗ ржЖрж╕ржмрзЗ?тАЩтАЩтАж
ржмрж╛ржЗрж░рзЗ рждржЦржи ржерж┐ржХржерж┐ржХрзЗ ржорж╛ржирзБрж╖рзЗрж░ ржврж▓ред рждрж╛ржБржХрзЗ рж╕рж┐-ржЕржл ржХрж░рждрзЗ ржПрж╕рзЗржЫрзЗржиред ржЪрзЛржЦрзЗрж░ ржЬрж▓рзЗ рж░рзЯрзНржпрж╛рж▓-рж╕рзНржпрж╛рж▓рзБржЯ ржжрж┐ржЪрзНржЫрзЗржи рждрж╛ржБрж░рж╛тАж!

From a write up of Sarbani Mukhopadhyay in Ananda Bazar Patrika ,,,,conversation with Mousumi Chhattopadhyay
[25/06/2018, 2:02:50] тАк+91┬а94322┬а49285тАм: ржирж┐ржЙ ржЗрзЯрж░рзНржХ ржкрзНрж░ржмрж╛рж╕рзА рж▓рзЗржЦржХ ржорж╛ржиржирзАрзЯ ржкрж╛рж░рзНрже ржмрзНржпрж╛ржирж╛рж░рзНржЬрзА ржорж╣рж╛рж╢рзЯ ржЕрждрзНржпржирзНржд рж╣рждрж╛рж╢рж╛ржЬржиржХ ржПржХржЯрж╛ рж╕рждрзНржпрж┐ ржмрзНржпржкрж╛рж░ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ рж╕рзБржирзНржжрж░ рж▓рж┐ржЦрзЗржЫрзЗржи ржУржирж╛рж░ ржлрзЗржмрзБ ржжрзЗржУрзЯрж╛рж▓рзЗред ржПржЦрж╛ржирзЗ ржжрж┐рж▓рж╛ржоред ржкрзЬрзЗ ржжрзЗржЦрждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░рзЗржи:

"ржЗрждрж┐рж╣рж╛рж╕ рж╕ржорзНржкрж░рзНржХрзЗ ржЖржорж┐ ржпрзЗржЯрзБржХрзБ ржЬрж╛ржирж┐, рждрж╛рждрзЗ ржЖржорж╛рж░ ржоржирзЗ рж╣рзЯ ржорж╛ржиржмрж╕ржнрзНржпрждрж╛рж░ ржПрждрзЛ ржнрзЯржВржХрж░ ржжрзБрж░рзНржжрж┐ржи ржЖржЧрзЗ ржХржЦржирзЛ ржЖрж╕рзЗржирж┐ред 

рждрж╛рж░ ржХрж╛рж░ржг рж╢рзБржзрзБ ржбрзЛржирж╛рж▓рзНржб ржЯрзНрж░рж╛ржорзНржк ржмрж╛ ржкрзБржЯрж┐ржи ржмрж╛ ржорзЛржжрзА ржирзЯред ржлрзНржпрж╛рж╕рж┐ржЬржо, ржШрзГржгрж╛ ржУ ржнрзЯрзЗрж░ рж░рж╛ржЬржирзАрждрж┐, ржмрж╛ ржпрзБржжрзНржз ржУ рж╣рж┐ржВрж╕рж╛рж░ ржорж╛ржзрзНржпржорзЗ рж▓ржХрзНрж╖ рж▓ржХрзНрж╖ ржирж░ржирж╛рж░рзА, ржкрж░рж┐ржмрж╛рж░ ржУ рж╢рж┐рж╢рзБ ржирж┐ржзржи ржЖржЧрзЗржУ рж╣рзЯрзЗржЫрзЗред рж╣рж┐ржЯрж▓рж╛рж░, ржЕрж╕рзБржЗржЬ ржХржирзНрж╕рзЗржирзНржЯрзНрж░рзЗрж╢ржи ржХрзНржпрж╛ржорзНржк, рж╕рзНржЯрзНржпрж╛рж▓рж┐ржирзЗрж░ ржЧржгрж╣рждрзНржпрж╛, ржкрж▓ржкржЯ, ржирж╛ржиржХрж┐ржВ ржорзНржпрж╛рж╕рж╛ржХрж╛рж░ред ржнрж┐рзЯрзЗрждржирж╛ржо, ржмрж╛ржВрж▓рж╛ржжрзЗрж╢рзЗрж░ ржмрж░рзНржмрж░рждрж╛ред ржмрзНрж░рж┐ржЯрж┐рж╢ржжрзЗрж░ рждрзИрж░рзА ржХрж░рж╛ ржоржирзНржмржирзНрждрж░ред рж▓ржХрзНрж╖ ржЧрж░рж┐ржм рж▓рзЛржХрзЗрж░ ржорзГрждрзНржпрзБред ржПрж╕ржм ржЖржорж░рж╛ ржжрзЗржЦрзЗржЫрж┐ред рж╢рзБржирзЗржЫрж┐ред 

ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржпрж╛ ржжрзЗржЦрж┐ржирж┐, рж╢рзБржирж┐ржирж┐, рждрж╛ рж╣рж▓рзЛ ржорж╛ржирзБрж╖рзЗрж░ ржоржирзЗрж░ рж╕ржорзНржкрзВрж░рзНржг рж╕рзНржмрзЗржЪрзНржЫрж╛ржорзГрждрзНржпрзБ, ржпрзЗржЦрж╛ржирзЗ ржорж╛ржирзБрж╖ -- ржПржоржиржХрж┐ рж╢рж┐ржХрзНрж╖рж┐ржд ржорж╛ржирзБрж╖, ржЙржЪрзНржЪрж╢рж┐ржХрзНрж╖рж┐ржд ржорж╛ржирзБрж╖ -- рж╕рж┐ржжрзНржзрж╛ржирзНржд ржирж┐рзЯрзЗржЫрзЗ, рждрж╛рж░рж╛ ржХрзЛржирзЛ ржкрзНрж░рж╢рзНржи ржХрж░ржмрзЗржирж╛, ржЖрж▓рзЛржЪржирж╛ ржХрж░ржмрзЗржирж╛, ржмрж┐рждрж░рзНржХ ржмрж┐рж╢рзНрж▓рзЗрж╖ржг ржХрж░ржмрзЗржирж╛ред ржпрж╛ ржжрзЗржЦрж▓рзЗ, ржпрж╛ рж╢рзБржирж▓рзЗ, ржЬрж╛ржирж▓рзЗ рж╕рзБржЦ рж╢рж╛ржирзНрждрж┐ ржЕржЯрзНржЯрж╣рж╛рж╕рж┐ ржПржХржЯрж╛ржирж╛ ржЖржиржирзНржж ржмрзНржпрж╛рж╣ржд рж╣рзЯ, рж░рж╛рждрзЗрж░ ржШрзБржорзЗрж░ ржХрзЛржирзЛрж░ржХржо ржмрзНржпрж╛ржШрж╛ржд ржШржЯрзЗ, ржХрзЛржирзЛрж░ржХржо ржЕржЦрзБрж╢рж┐рж░ ржХрж╛рж░ржг ржШржЯрзЗ, рждрж╛ ржорж╛ржирзБрж╖ рж╢рзБржирждрзЗ ржЪрж╛ржЗржмрзЗржирж╛, ржЬрж╛ржирждрзЗ ржЪрж╛ржЗржмрзЗржирж╛ред 

ржЯрзНрж░рж╛ржорзНржк рж╢рж┐рж╢рзБржжрзЗрж░ рждрж╛ржжрзЗрж░ ржмрж╛ржмрж╛ржорж╛рзЯрзЗрж░ ржерзЗржХрзЗ ржЬрзЛрж░ ржХрж░рзЗ ржХрзЗрзЬрзЗ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ ржЦрж╛ржБржЪрж╛рзЯ ржкрзБрж░рзЗ ржжрж┐ржЪрзНржЫрзЗ, рждрж╛рждрзЗржУ ржЖржорзЗрж░рж┐ржХрж╛рж░ ржмрзЗрж╢рж┐рж░ ржнрж╛ржЧ ржорж╛ржирзБрж╖рзЗрж░ рждрзЗржоржи ржХрзЛржирзЛ ржХрж╖рзНржЯ ржирзЗржЗред ржЯрзНрж░рж╛ржорзНржкрзЗрж░ рж░рзЗржЯрж┐ржВ ржкрзЬрзЗ ржпрж╛ржЪрзНржЫрзЗржирж╛ред рж▓рзЛржХрзЗ ржПржЗ ржЖрж▓рзЛржЪржирж╛рзЯ ржЕржВрж╢ржЧрзНрж░рж╣ржг ржХрж░рждрзЗржЗ ржирж╛рж░рж╛ржЬред ржнрж╛рж░рждрзЗрж░ ржмрзЗрж╢рж┐рж░ржнрж╛ржЧ рж▓рзЛржХ, ржмрж╛ ржПржжрзЗрж╢рзЗ ржпрзЗрж╕ржм ржнрж╛рж░рждрзАрзЯ ржУ ржмрж╛ржЩрж╛рж▓рж┐ ржерж╛ржХрзЗ, рждрж╛рж░рж╛ ржПрж╕ржм ржЖрж▓рзЛржЪржирж╛ ржпрж╛рж░рж╛ рждрзЛрж▓рзЗ, рждрж╛ржжрзЗрж░ ржкржЫржирзНржж ржХрж░рзЗржирж╛ред

ржЖржЬржХрзЗрж░ ржкрзГржерж┐ржмрзАрждрзЗ ржХрзА ржШржЯржЫрзЗ, рж╕рзЗрж╕ржм ржЬрж╛ржирж╛рж░ ржПржХрзЗржмрж╛рж░рзЗржЗ ржХрзЛржирзЛ ржЕрж╕рзБржмрж┐ржзрзЗ ржирзЗржЗред рж╕рж╛рж░рж╛ ржмрж┐рж╢рзНржмрзЗрж░ рж╕ржорж╕рзНржд ржЦржмрж░ ржЖржорж╛ржжрзЗрж░ ржЪрзЛржЦрзЗрж░ рж╕рж╛ржоржирзЗ ржЖржЫрзЗред ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржорж╛ржирзБрж╖ рж╕рзНржерж┐рж░ ржХрж░рзЗржЫрзЗ, ржпрзЗрж╣рзЗрждрзБ ржЪрж┐ржирзНрждрж╛ржнрж╛ржмржирж╛, ржмрж┐ржЪрж╛рж░ ржмрж┐рж╢рзНрж▓рзЗрж╖ржг ржХрж░рж╛ рж╕ржорзЯрж╕рж╛ржкрзЗржХрзНрж╖, ржПржмржВ рждрж╛ ржХрж░рж▓рзЗ ржоржирзЗрж░ рж╢рж╛ржирзНрждрж┐, ржжрзИрж╣рж┐ржХ рж╕рзБржЦ ржмрж┐ржШрзНржирж┐ржд рж╣рзЯ, ржХрж╖рзНржЯ рж╣рзЯ, ржпржирзНрждрзНрж░ржгрж╛ рж╣рзЯ, ржнрзЯ рж╣рзЯ, ржЕрж╕рзНржерж┐рж░рждрж╛ ржмрж╛рзЬрзЗред рж╕рзБрждрж░рж╛ржВ, ржХрзЛржирзЛрж░ржХржо ржорж╛ржирж╕рж┐ржХ ржХрж╖рзНржЯрзЗрж░ ржоржзрзНржпрзЗ рж╕рзЗ ржЖрж░ ржпрж╛ржмрзЗржирж╛ред

[26/06/2018, 17:37:39] тАк+91┬а97044┬а12444тАм: A Boeing 777 wide-body jetliner was lumbering along at 800km/hour at 33000 feet when a cocky F-16 fighter jet flashed by at Mach 2.
 
The F-16 pilot decided to show off. 

On his state of the art radio that is part of his state of the art 3D & million dollar headset, the F-16 youngster told the 777 pilot, *тАЬHey Captain, watch this!тАЭ*

He promptly went into a barrel roll, followed by a steep, unimaginable, vertical climb. He then finished with a sonic boom as he broke the sound barrier, as the F-16 screamed down at impossible GтАЩs before levelling at almost sea level.

The F-16 pilot asked the 777 pilot what he thought of that?

The 777 pilot said, *тАЬThat was truly impressive, but watch this!тАЭ*

The 777 chugged along for about 5 minutes at the steady 800km/hour, and then the 777 pilot came back on and said, *тАЬWhat did you think of that?тАЭ*
 
Puzzled, the cocky F-16 pilot asked, *тАЬWhat the heck did you do?тАЭ*

The 777 pilot chuckled and said, *"I stood up, stretched my legs, walked  to the back, used the toilet, then got a cup of coffee and a cinnamon roll and secured a date for the next 3 nights in a five star hotel paid for by the company"*
 
LESSON OF LIFE:

When you are young and foolish, speed and flash may seem like a good thing!

When you get older and smarter, comfort and dullness is not such a bad thing!

It's called *S.O.S.*

*Slower, Older and Smarter !*

Dedicated to all my friends approaching S.O.S.

[29/06/2018, 13:58:15] тАк+91┬а94322┬а49285тАм: Bongs are quintessential food lovers that no one can deny. My day starts and ends with food, and my bong origin is only to be blamed for that!

Amra Shorbobhukh (We eat everything)

Amra Jol Khai (We eat water)
Abar amra Hawa o khai (We eat air!)
Amra Cigarette khai (We eat Cigarette)
Abar amra Mod o khai (We eat Alcoholic drinks!)

Amra Lyadh Khai (We "eat" Laziness, or rather laziness eats us!)
Amra Himshim Khai (how do I translate this one! this is what we say when we are going crazy with multiple things that is beyond our capacity to handle)
Abar amra Khaabi o Khai (God help me now...this is when we are in the water and unable to swim!)

Amra Loker Matha Khai (We eat others' head!)
Amra Bhimri Khai (Ok, this means we are suffering from epilepsy...now can you beat that?!)
Amra Case o khai (Sorry, can't translate this one)
Amra Baansh o khai (Beyond translation)
Amra Palti khai (When we change sides)
Amra bishom o khai (hiccups)

So you see, its no wonder that majority of Bongs have protruding bellies - after all we eat so many things that cannot be digested at all!

ржнрзЛрж░ржмрзЗрж▓рж╛ ржШрзБржо ржнрж╛ржЩрж▓ ржмрж┐ржмрзЗржХрж╛ржиржирзНржжрзЗрж░ ред рждрж╛ржХрж╛рж▓рзЗржи ржХрзНржпрж╛рж▓рзЗржирзНржбрж╛рж░рзЗрж░ ржжрж┐ржХрзЗ ред ржЖржЬржЗ рждрзЛ рж╕рзЗржЗ ржжрж┐ржи ред ржЖржорзЗрж░рж┐ржХрж╛рж░ рж╕рзНржмрж╛ржзрзАржирждрж╛ ржжрж┐ржмрж╕ред ржЖрж░ ржЖржорж╛рж░ ржжрзЗрж╣рждрзНржпрж╛ржЧрзЗрж░ ржжрж┐ржиред ржорж╛ ржнрзБржмржирзЗрж╢рзНржмрж░рзА ржжрзЗржмрзАрж░ ржорзБржЦржЯрж┐ ржоржирзЗ ржкржбрж╝рж▓ рждрж╛ржБрж░ред ржзрзНржпрж╛ржи ржХрж░рж▓рзЗржи рж╕рзЗржЗ ржжржпрж╝рж╛ржоржпрж╝ ржкрзНрж░рж╕ржирзНржи ржорзБржЦржЯрж┐ред ржмрзБржХрзЗрж░ ржоржзрзНржпрзЗ ржЕржирзБржнржм ржХрж░рж▓рзЗржи ржирж┐ржмрж┐ржбрж╝ ржмрзЗржжржирж╛ ред

ржоржирзНржжрж┐рж░рзЗ ржЧрзЗрж▓рзЗржи рж╕рзНржмрж╛ржорзАржЬрж┐ ред ржзрзНржпрж╛ржиржоржЧрзНржи ржЙржкрж╛рж╕ржирж╛ржпрж╝ ржХрж╛ржЯрж╛рж▓рзЗржи ржЕржирзЗржХржХрзНрж╖ржи ред ржЖржЬ рж╕ржХрж╛рж▓ ржерзЗржХрзЗржЗ рждрж╛ржБрж░ ржоржирзЗрж░ ржоржзрзНржпрзЗ ржЧрзБржи ржЧрзБржи ржХрж░ржЫрзЗ ржЧрж╛ржи ред ржЕрж╕рзБрж╕рзНржерждрж╛рж░ рж▓ржХрзНрж╖ржи ржирзЗржЗ ржмрж▓рзЗржЗ ржлрж┐рж░рзЗ ржПрж╕рзЗржЫрзЗ ржЧрж╛ржи, рж╕рзБрж░, ржЖржиржирзНржж ред рждрж╛ржБрж░ ржоржирзЗ ржЖрж░ ржХрзЛржиржУ ржЕрж╢рж╛ржирзНрждрж┐ ржирзЗржЗ ред рж╢рж╛ржирзНржд , рж╕рзНржирж┐ржЧрзНржз рж╣ржпрж╝рзЗ ржЖржЫрзЗ рждрж╛ржБрж░ ржЕржирзНрждрж░ред

ржмрзЗрж▓рж╛ ржПржЧрж╛рж░рзЛржЯрж╛ ржкрж░рзНржпржирзНржд ржзрзНржпрж╛ржирзЗ ржоржЧрзНржи рж░ржЗрж▓рзЗржи рж╕рзНржмрж╛ржорзАржЬрж┐ ред ржзрзНржпрж╛ржи ржнрж╛ржЩрж▓рзЗ ржарж╛ржХрзБрж░рзЗрж░ ржмрж┐ржЫрж╛ржирж╛ ржЫрзЗржбрж╝рзЗ ржЧрж╛ржи ржЧрж╛ржЗрждрзЗ ржЧрж╛ржЗрждрзЗ ржмрзЗрж░рж┐ржпрж╝рзЗ ржПрж▓рзЗржи рждрж┐ржирж┐ --

 ржЧрзБрж░рзБржнрж╛ржЗржжрзЗрж░ рж╕ржЩрзНржЧрзЗ ржорж╣рж╛ржиржирзНржжрзЗ ржЗрж▓рж┐рж╢ржнржХрзНрж╖ржирзЗ ржмрж╕рж▓рзЗржи ржмрж┐ржмрзЗржХрж╛ржиржирзНржж ред рждрж┐ржирж┐ ржЬрж╛ржирзЗржи, ржЖрж░ ржорж╛рждрзНрж░ ржХржпрж╝рзЗржХржШржирзНржЯрж╛рж░ ржкрже рждрж╛ржБржХрзЗ ржкрзЗрж░рзЛрждрзЗ рж╣ржмрзЗ ред ржбрж╛ржХрзНрждрж╛рж░рзЗрж░ ржЙржкржжрзЗрж╢ ржорзЗржирзЗ ржЪрж▓рж╛рж░ ржЖрж░ ржкрзНрж░ржпрж╝рзЛржЬржи ржирзЗржЗ ред ржЬрзАржмржирзЗрж░ рж╢рзЗрж╖ ржжрж┐ржиржЯрж╛ рждрзЛ ржЖржиржирзНржжрзЗржЗ ржХрж╛ржЯрж╛ржирзЛ ржЙржЪрж┐рждред

'ржПржХрж╛ржжрж╢рзА ржХрж░рзЗ ржЦрж┐ржжрзЗржЯрж╛ ржЦрзБржм ржмрзЗржбрж╝рзЗржЫрзЗред ржШржЯрж┐ржмрж╛ржЯрж┐ржЧрзБрж▓рзЛржУ ржЦрзЗржпрж╝рзЗ ржлрзЗрж▓рждрзЗ ржЗржЪрзНржЫрзЗ ржХрж░ржЫрзЗ ред' ржмрж▓рж▓рзЗржи рж╕рзНржмрж╛ржорзАржЬрж┐ ред

рждрж┐ржирж┐ ржкрж╛ржгрж┐ржирж┐рж░ ржмрзНржпрж╛ржХрж░ржгрзЗрж░ рж╕рзВрждрзНрж░ржЧрзБрж▓рж┐ ржирж╛ржирж╛рж░ржХржо ржоржЬрж╛рж░ ржЧрж▓рзНржкрзЗрж░ рж╕ржЩрзНржЧрзЗ ржЬрзБржбрж╝рзЗ ржжрж┐рждрзЗ рж▓рж╛ржЧрж▓рзЗржи ред

ржПрждржЯрж╛ рж╣рж╛ржБржЯрж╛ рждрж╛ржБрж░ рж╢рж░рзАрж░ ржЗржжрж╛ржирж┐ржВ ржирж┐рждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░ржЫрзЗ ржирж╛ ред

Killer joke:..

The Students of MBBS were attending their 1st Biochemistry Class. They all gathered around the Lab table with a Urine sample. The Professor dip His Finger in urine & tasted it in his own mouth.┬а 
Then he asked the Students to do the same. The students hesitated for several minutes, but at last every one dipped their finger in urine sample & tasted it.... 
When everyone finished, the Professor looked at them & said: The most important Quality is 'Observation'.┬а I dipped my MIDDLE Finger but tasted the INDEX Finger. Today you just Learnt, "How to Pay Attention".┬а All Students shouted...

[10/07/2018, 22:21:20] тАк+91┬а94322┬а49285тАм: ржХржмрж┐ ржХрзЗ, ржЬрж╛ржирж┐ржирж╛ред ржкржбрж╝рзЗ  ржнрж╛рж▓рзЛ рж▓рж╛ржЧрж▓рзЛ рждрж╛ржЗ share ржХрж░рж▓рж╛ржоред

*ржмрж╛ржЩрж╛рж▓рж┐*

*ржмрж╛ржЩрж╛рж▓рж┐ ржЖржЬ ржмржжрж▓рзЗ ржЧрзЗржЫрзЗ,* 
   *ржЖржжржм ржХрж╛рзЯржжрж╛ ржЖрж░ ржнрж╛рж╖рж╛рждрзЗ редред*
*рж╢рж╛рзЬрж┐, ржзрзБрждрж┐ ржЦрзБрж▓рзЗ ржлрзЗрж▓рзЗржЫрзЗ*, 
   *ржЖржзрзБржирж┐ржХ рж╣ржмрж╛рж░ ржЖрж╢рж╛рждрзЗ редред* 

*ржорж╛ , ржмрж╛ржмрж╛ ржкрзНрж░рж╛рзЯ ржЙржарзЗржЗ ржЧрзЗржЫрзЗ,*  
    *ржорж╛ржорзНржорж┐, ржкрж╛ржкрж╛рж░ ржарзЗрж▓рж╛рждрзЗ редред* 
*рж╣рж╛рж░рж┐рзЯрзЗ ржЧрзЗржЫрзЗ рж╕ржорзНржорзЛржзржи ржЧрзБрж▓рзЛ,* 
    *ржмрж┐рж▓рж┐рждрж┐ ржнрж╛рж╖рж╛рж░ ржЪрж╛ржкрзЗрждрзЗ редред*

*ржХрзЛржерж╛рзЯ ржЧрзЗрж▓рзЛ рж░рж╛ржЩрж╛ржорж╛ржорж╛ ,*

1.  We donтАЩt understand food without *Daal* or *Maach*!

2. As a kid we are maniacal for *half marks* in our test papers

4. *Onek hoeche, ebar porte bosho* was our parents' childhood anthem

5. We have learned and taught ourselves the bong echoтАУsystem:

 *Khabaar-Dabaar,     Aaje-Baaje,            Poisha-Toisha,         Mota-Sota*

6. As a mischievous kid we have faced some real lovable words :

*Bandor and Bandraami*

*тАШBotamтАЩ and тАШSepti тАУ pinтАЩ*; 

8. We know the magic of the *afternoon nap*

*'chinte parcho?тАЩ*

12.  For us distance is never in kilometres, it is always in minutes. 

Like *тАШkoto dure achhis?'*  and answer is *тАШei toh panch  minitтАЩ*

*тАШpet bhore kheychis toh?тАЩ*

   *GHORAR DIM*

International dictionary fails to translate.

[11/07/2018, 20:56:52] тАк+91┬а97044┬а12444тАм: Travel Tip :
HEREтАЩS WHY YOU SHOULD LEAVE A COIN IN THE FREEZER, EVERY TIME BEFORE YOU LEAVE THE HOUSE. AMAZING!


You might think: тАЬCertainly there was no power outage!тАЭ. Even if it was, you simply cannot know how long there was no electricity, right?
There is possibility that it was for several days, leading to defrost food and its deterioration. Once the electricity comes back, foods freeze again and you almost do not notice that they were thawed.
It is fact that this can be really dangerous as certain types of foods are at risk of spreading salmonella and other bacteria!
Below we are going to present you a way to find out if and how long your freezer was without electricity!
Now you can find out if you can consume the food or it was too long being in warm.
For this you need:
яВз a cup
яВз coin
яВз water
First pour water into a cup and place it in the freezer. When the water in the cup is frozen, put a coin on top of the frozen water in the cup and then return it to the freezer.
After returning home from holiday, before taking out the food from the freezer, look at where the coin is!
If the coin is still at the top or in the middle of the cup, there was no power failure or power outage was for a short time, so the water was only partly melted.
If the coin is at the bottom of a cup, it means that electricity failure was for a long time, so the water completely dissolved, and the coin sinks all the way to the bottom of the cup. At that point, it is advisable not to consume the foods from the freezer.
Brilliant trick which is supereasy to use. This is particularly useful when you go on longer trips!

[11/07/2018, 22:39:14] тАк+91┬а99033┬а87874тАм: This is one of the best suspense jokes till date
ЁЯШЬ

A Father put his 3year old daughter to bed, told her a story and listened to her prayers which ended by saying, 
"God bless Mommy, God bless Daddy, God bless Grandma and good-bye Grandpa."

The father asked, 'Why did you say good-bye Grandpa?'

The little girl said, "I don't know daddy, it just seemed like the thing to do."

The next day grandpa died. 
The father thought it was a strange coincidence.

A few months later the father put the girl to bed and listened to her prayers which went like this, "God bless Mommy, God Bless Daddy and good-bye Grandma."

The next day the grandmother died.

"Holy crap" thought the father, "this kid is in contact with the other side."

Several weeks later when the girl was going to bed the dad heard her say, "God bless Mommy and good-bye Daddy."

He practically went into shock. He couldn't sleep all night and got up at the crack of dawn to go to his office. 

He was nervous as a cat all day, had lunch and watched the clock.. He figured if he could get by until midnight he would be okay. 

He felt safe in the office, so instead of going home at the end of the day he stayed there, drinking coffee, looking at his watch and jumping at every sound. Finally midnight arrived; he breathed a sigh of relief and went home.

When he got home his wife said, "I've never seen you work so late. What's the matter?"

He said, "I don't want to talk about it, I've just spent the worst day of my life."

She said, "You think you had a bad day, you'll never believe what happened to me. This morning my boss died in the middle of a meeting!"
ЁЯШЬЁЯШЭЁЯШЭЁЯШВЁЯШВ
.
.
.
.
Enjoy fun suspense thrillerЁЯШД

Blast of the day:
Best Answer given by an Indian Citizen:-
My Income Tax return form has been sent back to me because, In response to a question 'Number of Dependents on you?',  I replied :--- 
"97% of population who dont pay taxes, 21 million illegal immigrants, 9,00,000 criminals in over 1382 prisons and above all 544+ MPs in parliament"and 4000 MLA's of states.
They said, this is not an acceptable answer.
I am still wondering..... Who the hell did I miss out!!.

[15/07/2018, 21:49:51] тАк+91┬а94322┬а49285тАм: HR Manager wrote a love letter to his girlfriend!!

Ever wondered how a HR manager could write a love letter .

Dear Radha,

Sub: Offer of Love!

I am very happy to Inform you that I have fallen In love with you since the 12th of March (Thursday) with reference to the meeting held between us on the 11h of March (Wednesday) at 15:00hrs,

I would like to present myself as a prospective lover.

Our love affair would be on probation for a period of three months and depending upon compatibility, it would be made permanent.

Upon completion of the probation, there will be a continuous on-the-job training and performance appraisal schemes leading up to promotion from lover to spouse.

The expenses Incurred for coffee and entertainment would be initially shared equally between us.

Later, based on your performance, I might take up a larger share of the expenses.

However, I am broadminded enough to take care of your expenses account.

Request you to kindly respond within 7 days of receiving this letter, Failing which, this offer would be cancelled without further notice and I shall be considering someone else.

I would be happy, if you could forward this letter to your sister, if you do not wish to take up this offer.

Wish you all the best.

Thanking you In anticipation,

Yours sincerely,

[28/09/2018, 14:18:01] тАк+91┬а94322┬а49285тАм: ржЖржХржмрж░ ... ржЬрж╛ржЩрзНржЧрж┐ржпрж╝рж╛ ржкржбрж╝рждрзЗржи ржирж╛
----------------------------------------------
рж╕рзНржХрзБрж▓ржЯрж┐ржЪрж╛рж░ ржжрзАржиржирж╛рже ржмрж╛ржмрзБрж░ рж╕рзНрждрзНрж░рзА ржорж╛ржЭрж░рж╛рждрзЗ  ржЙржарзЗ ржжрзЗржЦрж▓рзЗржи, рж╕рзНржмрж╛ржорзАрж░ ржжрзБ ржЪрзЛржЦ рж▓рж╛рж▓, ржорж╛ржерж╛рж░ ржЪрзБрж▓ ржПрж▓рзЛржорзЗрж▓рзЛред ржкрж░рзАржХрзНрж╖рж╛рж░ ржЦрж╛рждрж╛ ржЦрзБрж▓рзЗ ржПржХржжрзГрж╖рзНржЯрзЗ ржЦрж╛рждрж╛рж░ ржжрж┐ржХрзЗ рждрж╛ржХрж┐ржпрж╝рзЗред 

рж╕рзНрждрзНрж░рзА : ржП ржХрзА? рж░рж╛ржд ржжрж╢ржЯрж╛ ржерзЗржХрзЗ ржжрзЗржЦржЫрж┐ ржПржЗ ржЦрж╛рждрж╛ржЯрж╛ ржирж┐ржпрж╝рзЗржЗ ржмрж╕рзЗ ржЖржЫрзЛ ? ржХрзЗржи ? 

рж╢рж┐ржХрзНрж╖ржХржГ рж╣рзНржпрж╛ржБ, ржУржХрзЗ ржХржд ржирж╛ржорзНржмрж╛рж░ ржжрзЗржм ржмрзБржЭрждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░ржЫрж┐ ржирж╛ред

рж╕рзНрждрзНрж░рзАржГ ржХрзЗржи? ржХрзА рж▓рж┐ржЦрзЗржЫрзЗ?

рж╢рж┐ржХрзНрж╖ржХржГ рж▓рж┐ржЦрзЗржЫрзЗ, "ржЖржХржмрж░ ржмрж┐ржкржжрзЗрж░ ржжрж┐ржирзЗ ржЬрж╛ржЩрж┐ржпрж╝рж╛ ржкрж░рж┐рждрзЗржи ржирж╛ред"

рж╕рзНрждрзНрж░рзАрж░ ржЪрзЛржЦ ржХржкрж╛рж▓рзЗ ржЙржарзЗ ржЧрзЗрж▓ред ржП ржЖржмрж╛рж░ ржХрзА? рждрж┐ржирж┐ рж╕рзНржмрж╛ржорзАржХрзЗ ржкрзНрж░рж╢рзНржи ржХрж░рж▓рзЗржи,  ржЬрж╛ржЩрж┐ржпрж╝рж╛ ржкрж░рж┐рждрзЗржи ржирж╛ ? ржорж╛ржирзЗ ?  рждржЦржи рждрзЛ ржЬрж╛ржЩрж┐ржпрж╝рж╛рж░ ржХрзЛржорзНржкрж╛ржирж┐ржЗ ржЫрж┐рж▓ ржирж╛!

рж╢рж┐ржХрзНрж╖ржХржГ рж╕рзЗржЯрж╛ржЗ рждрзЛ ржнрж╛ржмржЫрж┐ред ржХрзЗржи рж▓рж┐ржЦрж▓ !

рж╕рзНрждрзНрж░рзА ржЪрж▓рзЗ ржЧрзЗрж▓рзЗржиред ржнрзЛрж░ рж░рж╛рждрзНрж░рзЗ ржПржХржЯрж╛ рж╣рж▓рзНрж▓рж╛рж░ ржЖржУржпрж╝рж╛ржЬрзЗ рж╕рзНрждрзНрж░рзАрж░ ржШрзБржо ржнрзЗржЩрзЗ ржЧрзЗрж▓ред ржЙржарзЗ ржжрзЗржЦрж▓рзЗржи, рж╕рзНржмрж╛ржорзА ржЕрждрзНржпржирзНржд ржЖржиржирзНржжрзЗрж░ ржнржЩрзНржЧрж┐рждрзЗ ржЙржирзНржорж╛ржжрзЗрж░ ржоржд рж╕рж╛рж░рж╛ ржШрж░рзЗ ржирзЗржЪрзЗ ржмрзЗржбрж╝рж╛ржЪрзНржЫрзЗржи, рж╕рж╛рж░рж╛ ржШрж░рзЗ ржЦрж╛рждрж╛ ржХрж▓ржо ржЫржбрж╝рж╛ржирзЛред рж╕рзНрждрзНрж░рзАржХрзЗ ржжрзЗржЦрзЗ рж╕рзНржмрж╛ржорзАрж░ ржЙрж▓рзНрж▓рж╛рж╕ ржжрзНржмрж┐ржЧрзБржг ржмрзЗржбрж╝рзЗ ржЧрзЗрж▓ред рж╕рзНрждрзНрж░рзАржХрзЗ ржЬржбрж╝рж┐ржпрж╝рзЗ ржзрж░рзЗ ржмрж▓рж▓рзЗржи , ржЧрж┐ржирзНржирзА, ржирж╛ржорзНржмрж╛рж░ ржжрж┐ржпрж╝рзЗржЫрж┐ред 

рж╕рзНрждрзНрж░рзАржГ ржжрж┐ржпрж╝рзЗржЫрзЛ ? ржХржд ?

рж╢рж┐ржХрзНрж╖ржХржГ рж╢рзВржгрзНржпред

ржмрж┐рж╕рзНржлрж╛рж░рж┐ржд ржЪрзЛржЦрзЗ рж╕рзНрждрзНрж░рзА ржмрж▓рж▓рзЗржи , рж╕рж╛рж░рж╛рж░рж╛ржд ржЬрзЗржЧрзЗ, рж╢рзВржгрзНржп ржжрж┐рж▓рзЗ ?

рж╢рж┐ржХрзНрж╖ржХржГ рж╣рзНржпрж╛ржБред 

рж╕рзНрждрзНрж░рзАржГ ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржХрзЗржи?

рж╢рж┐ржХрзНрж╖ржХржГ ржорж╛рж▓ ржЯрзБржХрж▓рж┐ ржХрж░рзЗржЫрзЗред

рж╕рзНрждрзНрж░рзА ржкрзНрж░рж╛ржпрж╝ ржкржбрж╝рзЗ ржпрж╛ржпрж╝,  ржЯрзБржХрж▓рж┐? рждрж╛рж░ ржорж╛ржирзЗ ржЖрж░рзЛ ржЕржирзЗржХрзЗ рж▓рж┐ржЦрзЗржЫрзЗ?

рж╢рж┐ржХрзНрж╖ржХржГ ржирж╛ред

рж╕рзНрждрзНрж░рзАржГ рждржмрзЗ?

ржжрзБржирж┐рзЯрж╛ ржЖржорж╛рзЯ рззрзп ржмржЫрж░ ржмрж╛ржБржЪрждрзЗ ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗржЫрзЗред рж╕рзЗржЗ ржЕржнрж┐рж╢ржкрзНржд рж░рж╛рждрзЗ ржЖржорж╛рж░ржЗ рждрзЛ ржорж░рзЗ ржпрж╛ржУрзЯрж╛ ржЙржЪрж┐ржд ржЫрж┐рж▓, рждрж╛ржЗ ржирж╛? ржЖржорж╛рж░ ржорзГрждржжрзЗрж╣ ржЫрзБржбрж╝рзЗ ржлрзЗрж▓рж╛рж░ ржХржерж╛ ржЫрж┐рж▓ рж╢рж╣рж░рзЗрж░ ржХрзЛржирзЛ ржЕржЬрзНржЮрж╛ржд ржХрзЛржгрзЗред ржХрзЯрзЗржХ ржжрж┐ржи ржкрж░ ржорж░рзНржЧрзЗ ржпрж╛ рж╢ржирж╛ржХрзНржд ржХрж░рж╛рж░ ржХржерж╛ ржЫрж┐рж▓ рждрзЛржорж╛рж░ред рж╕ржЩрзНржЧрзЗ ржПржЯрж╛ржУ ржЬрж╛ржирждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░рждрзЗ ржпрзЗ рж╣рждрзНржпрж╛рж░ ржЖржЧрзЗ ржЖржорж╛ржХрзЗ ржзрж░рзНрж╖ржгржУ ржХрж░рж╛ рж╣рзЯрзЗржЫрж┐рж▓ред рж╣рждрзНржпрж╛ржХрж╛рж░рзАрж░рж╛ ржЕржмрж╢рзНржпржЗ ржзрж░рж╛ ржкржбрж╝ржд ржирж╛, ржХрж╛рж░ржг ржЖржорж╛ржжрзЗрж░ ржирж╛ ржЖржЫрзЗ ржЕрж░рзНрже, ржирж╛ ржХрзНрж╖ржорждрж╛ред рждрж╛рж░ржкрж░ ржмрж╛ржХрж┐ ржЬрзАржмржиржЯрж╛ рж╕рзАржорж╛рж╣рзАржи рж╢рзЛржХ ржУ ржЕрж╕рж╣рзНржп рж▓ржЬрзНржЬрж╛рзЯ ржХрж╛ржЯрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржХрзЯрзЗржХ ржмржЫрж░ ржкрж░ рждрзЛржорж╛рж░ржУ ржорзГрждрзНржпрзБ рж╣рждрзЛред ржПржЯрж╛ржЗ ржпрзЗ рж╣ржУрзЯрж╛рж░ ржХржерж╛ ржЫрж┐рж▓ред

    ЁЯШВЁЯШВЁЯШВЁЯШВЁЯШВ
Mr. Kapoor comes home one night, and his wife throws her arms around his neck: "I have great newsтАж I'm a month overdue. I think we're going to have a baby!

The doctor gave me a test today, but until we find out for sure, we can't tell anybody."

The next day, Mrs. Kapoor receives a telephone call from Reliance Energy because the electricity bill has not been paid.

" Am I speaking to Mrs. Kapoor? "

"YesтАж speaking"

Reliance guy, "You're a month overdue, you know!"

"How do YOU know?" stammers the young woman.

"Well, ma'am, it's in our files!" says the Reliance guy.

"What are you saying? It's in your filesтАж HOW ???"

" Yes тАж.. We have a system of finding out who's overdue "

" GOD !!!тАж This is too muchтАж"

"Madam, I am sorryтАж I am just following ordersтАж I have to inform that you are overdue.."

"I know that тАж let me talk to my husband about this tonight. He will speak to your company tomorrow.. "

That night, she tells her husband about the incident, and he, mad as a bull,rushes to Reliance office the next day morning.

"What's going on? You have it on file that my wife is a month overdue? What business is that of yours?" the husband shouts..

"Just calm down," says the lady at the reception at Reliance, "it's nothing serious. All you have to do is pay us."

"PAY you? And if I refuse?"

"Well, in that case, sir, we'd have no option but to cut yours off.."

"And what would my wife do then?" the husband asks.

"WellтАж I don't know. I guess she'd have to use a candle !!!

A father told his 3 sons
 when he sent them to the
 university:

"I feel it's my duty to provide
 you with the best possible
 education, and you do not 
owe me anything for that.
 However, I want you to
 appreciate it. 

As a token, please each put
 Rs.1,00,000 into my coffin
 when I die."

And so it happened. His sons
 became a doctor, a lawyer
 and a financial planner,
 each very successful and
 financially sound.

When their father's time had 
come and they saw their
 father in the coffin, they
 remembered his wish.

First, it was the doctor who
 put 200 X Rs.500 notes on
 the chest of the deceased.

Then, came the financial
 planner, who also put
 50 x Rs2,000 there.

Finally, 
it was the heartbroken
 lawyer's turn. He dipped
 into his pocket, took out
 his cheque book, wrote a
 cheque for Rs3,00,000, put
 it under his father's body,
 took the Rs.2,00,000 cash 
and closed the
coffin's lid......

He is Famously known as
 *A. Jaitely*. ЁЯША

NO CASH TRANSACTION
 ALLOWED

Laughter is the best
 Medicine...

ЁЯЩПЁЯП╝

тАО[07/10/2018, 21:06:38] тАк+91┬а98408┬а52380тАм: тАО<attached: 00006480-VIDEO-2018-10-07-21-06-38.mp4>
[07/10/2018, 21:07:04] тАк+91┬а98408┬а52380тАм: In the United States, an estimated 5.4 million people have been diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease. This figure is growing rapidly with the ageing population.

One of them was Steve Newport. His wife, Mary Newport, was a doctor. Dr. Mary learned that her husband had severe Alzheimer's disease.

When the doctor examined her husband at the hospital, he asked Steve to paint a clock. Instead, he drew a few circles and then drew a few figures without any logic. It was not like a clock at all!.

The doctor pulled her aside and said: "Your husband is already on the verge of severe Alzheimer's disease!"

It turned out that it was a test of whether a person had Alzheimer's disease. Dr. Mary was very upset at that time, but as a doctor, she would not just give up. She began to study the disease. She found out Alzheimers disease was associated to glucose deficiency to the brain.

Her research says: "The dementia of the elderly is like having diabetes in the head ! Before one has the symptoms of Diabetes or Alzheimer's disease, the body has already had problems for 10 to 20 years."

According to Dr. Mary's study, Alzheimer's disease is very similar to Type 1 or Type 2 diabetes. The cause is also insulin imbalance.

Because insulin has a problem, it prevents the brain cells from absorbing glucose. Glucose is the nutrition of brain cells. Without glucose, brain cells die.

As it turns out, these high-quality proteins are the cells that feed our body.

But nutrition for our brain cell is glucose. As long as we have mastered the source of these two kinds of food, we are the masters of our own health!

The next question is, where to find glucose? It cannot be the ready-made glucose that we buy from the store. It is not from fruits such as grapes. She started looking for alternatives.

The alternative nutrients for brain cells are ketones. Ketones are necessary in brain cells. Ketones cannot be found in vitamins. 

*Coconut oil* contains triglicerides. After the triglycerides in *coconut oil* is consumed, it is metabolised into ketones in the liver. This is the alternative nutrient for brain cells!

After this scientific verification, Dr. Mary added *coconut oil* to her husband's food. After only two weeks, when he went to the hospital again to do painting and clock tests, the progress was amazing.

Dr. Mary said: "At that time, I thought, has God heard my prayers? Wouldn't it be coconut oil that worked ? But there is no other way.Anyway, it's better to continue taking the*coconut oil*."

Dr. Mary was now part of the traditional medical practice base. She clearly knew the capabilities of traditional medicine. 

Three weeks later, the third time she took him to do a smart clock test, the performance was better than the last time. This progress was not only intellectual, but also emotional and physical.

Dr. Mary said: "He could not do his running but now he can run. He could not read for a year and a half, but he can read again now after taking *coconut oil* for three months."

Her husband's actions had already begun to change. He did not speak in the mornings. Now she noticed a lot of changes: "Now after he gets up, he is spirited, talking and laughing. He drinks water himself and take utensils for himself on his own."

On the surface, these are very simple daily tasks, but only those who have come to the clinic or have demented relatives at home can experience the joy: It is not easy to see such progress!

After frying the greens & onions in coconut oil, making cakes with coconut, after taking 3 to 4 tablespoons of coconut oil per meal, 2-3 months later, the eyes too can now focus normally.

Her studies proved that *coconut oil* can really improve the problem of dementia in the elderly.

Apply *coconut oil* to bread. When coconut cream is used, the taste is unexpectedly good.

Young people can also use it for maintenance of health and prevention, and can improve if they have symptoms of dementia.

Dementia is caused because nutrients cannot be transported to brain cells, and nutrients must be passed from the body to the brain by insulin.

Especially for diabetic patients its not easy to get insulin secretion. тАЬNutrition cannot get to the brain. When brain cells are starved to death, they are deprived of intelligence.тАЭ

*Coconut oil* contains medium-chain triglyceride, which can supply nutrients to the brain without using insulin. 
*So, it can improve Alzheimer's disease and Parkinson's disease*.

After reading the article, don't forget to share it.

[08/10/2018, 0:09:55] тАк+91┬а94322┬а50033тАм: What is Audit? 

Once upon a time there was a shepherd looking after his sheep on the side of a deserted road. ЁЯРРЁЯРПЁЯРС

Suddenly a brand new Porsche screeches to a halt. The driver, a man dressed in an Armani suit, Cerutti shoes, Ray-Ban sunglasses, TAG-Heuer wrist watch, and a Pierre Cardin tie gets out and asks the shepherd, 'If I can tell you how many sheep you have, will you give me one of them?' 

The shepherd looks at
the young man, then looks at the large flock of grazing sheep and replies, 'Okay.'

The young man parks the car, connects his laptop to the mobile-fax, enters a NASA Website, scans the ground using his GPS, opens a database and 60 Excel tables filled with algorithms and pivot
tables. 

He then prints out a 150-page report on his high-tech
mini-printer, turns to the shepherd and says, тАШ'You have exactly 1,586 sheep.'. 

The shepherd cheers, 
"That's correct, you can have your choicest sheep from the herd". 

'The young man takes one of the animals which he likes most and cute  from the flock and puts it in the back of his Porsche. 

The shepherd looks at him and asks, 'If I guess your profession, will you return my animal to me?' 

The young man laughed and  answers, 'Yes, why not?' 

The shepherd says, 'You are an auditor.'

'How did you know?' asks the young man. 

'Very simple,' answers the shepherd.

1. First, you came here without being wanted. ЁЯШ│

2.Second, you charged me a fee to tell me something I already knew. ЁЯШ▒

3.Third, you don't understand anything about my business.....! ЁЯдФ

Now may  I please  have my DOG back? " ЁЯРХ

[08/10/2018, 23:41:19] тАк+91┬а99033┬а87874тАм: *I AM THE "7%"*

_This is something we should all read at least once a week!!!!! Make sure you read to the end!!!!!!_

_Written by *Regina Brett*, 90 years old, of the Plain b Dealer, Cleveland , Ohio_

_*To celebrate growing older, I once wrote few lessons life taught me. It is the most requested column I've ever written.*_

1. *Life isn't fair, but it's still good.*

2. *When in doubt, just take the next small step.*

3. *Your job won't take care of you when you are sick. Your friends and family will.*

4. *You don't have to win every argument. Stay true to yourself.*

5. *Cry with someone. It's more healing than crying alone.*

6. *Make peace with your past so it won't mess up the present.*

7. *Don't compare your life to others.  You have no idea what their journey is all about.*

8. *Take a deep breath every now and then. It calms the mind.*

9. *'Get rid of anything that isn't useful. Clutter weighs you down in many ways.*

10. *It's never too late to be happy. But itтАЩs all up to you and no one else.*

11. *Burn the candles, use the nice sheets, wear the fancy clothes. Don't save it for a special occasion. Today is special.*

12. *No one is in charge of your happiness but you.*

13. *Forgive others and yourself.*

14. *What other people think of you is none of your business.*

15. *Time heals almost everything. Give time a little time.*

16. *However good or bad a situation is, it will change.*

17. *Don't take yourself so seriously. No one else does.*

18. *Believe in miracles.*

19. *God loves you because of who God is, not because of anything you did or didn't do.*

20. *Growing old Beats the alternative of dying young.*

21. *Your children get only one childhood.*

22. *All that truly matters in the end is that you loved.*

23. *Get outside every day. Miracles are waiting everywhere.*

24. *Envy is waste of time. Accept what you already have, not what you need.*

25. *The best is yet to come...*

26. *No matter how you feel, get up, dress up and show up.*

27. *Life isn't tied with a bow, but it's still a gift."*

_Its estimated that 93% won't share this. If you are one of the *7%* who will, share this with the title *'7%'*._

_*I'm in the 7%. Friends are the family and family is best friends that you choose.*_

*Its worth reading again & again, as & when you can.*ЁЯШК 

*I'm in the 7%.*

[11/10/2018, 12:41:46] Anupom Roy: Branding BEC94 foundation, some of my  thoughts apart from fun food masti - 
1. Technical Seminars thought of in different cities - kolkata, delhi, bangalore, mumbai etc throughout 2019
2. Plus some form of grooming to existing students - industry relevance
3. Collect Corporate sponsorship for some philanthropic works related to college, technology, and society well being as a whole.
4. Enabling young minds to pursue research - infrastructure, industry connect, leading university connect... And many more that u guys suggest.

The underlying lever in each of the above is our engagement... We are reaching retiring age, many of us need to return to India... If some engagement clicks in a sustainable manner, its win win...

W: They say short hair is the fashion these days..
H: Then cut it
W: What if the fashion changes after I cut?
H: Then don't cut it 
W: All my friends say that I will look beautiful with a short hair..
H: Then cut it 
W: But I doubt whether short hair will suit my small face..
H: Then don't cut it 
W: But short hair is very easy to manage..
H: Then cut it 
W: But how can I wear flowers in my hair. I love to wear flowers. 
H: Then don't cut it

H: Then cut it

H: Then don't cut it 
W: Still I feel like giving it a try once
H: Then cut it

H: Then don't cut it

[19/10/2018, 1:12:48] тАк+44┬а7776┬а323999тАм: Absolutely brilliant joke.  After a long time, i could really relish an intelligent joke : 
Reunion Special: Read itЁЯШАЁЯШКЁЯШмЁЯШ│

Have you ever been guilty of looking at others your own age and thinking, "surely I can't look that old.". Well . . . you'll love this one..The stuff is from a lady called Archana

"My name is Archana. I was sitting in the waiting room for my first appointment with a new dentist.

I noticed his BDS degree on the wall, which bore his full name.

Suddenly, I remembered a tall , handsome, dark-haired boy with the same name had been in my high school class some 35-odd years ago.

Could he be the same guy that I had a secret crush on, way back then?

Upon seeing him, however, I quickly discarded any such thought. This balding, gray-haired man with the deeply lined face was way too old to have been my classmate.

After he examined my teeth, I asked him if he had attended New English School, Bandra(W).

"Yes. yes, I did.' he gleamed with pride.

"When did you complete schooling ?" I asked.

He answered, "In 1983. Why do you ask?"

"You were in my class!!!!", I exclaimed.

He looked at me closely.

Then, 
that
ugly,
old,
bald,
wrinkled faced,
gray-haired,
decrepit,
idiot,

[19/10/2018, 15:25:55] тАк+91┬а99033┬а87874тАм: *Dasha Hara is a Sanskrit word which means removal of ten bad qualities within you* :

*Ahankara* (Ego)
*Amanavta* (Cruelty)
*Anyaaya* (Injustice)
*Kama vasana* (Lust)
*Krodha* (Anger)
*Lobha* (Greed)
*Mada* (Over Pride)
*Matsara* (Jealousy)
*Moha* (Attachment)
*Swartha* (Selfishness)

Hence, also known as *'Vijaydashami'* signifying *тАЭVijayaтАЭ(Win)* over these ten bad qualities.

May we all be free from negativities and realise our true self through regular meditation and complete surrender towards the Divine. 

"Happy Dussehra" to all divine souls ЁЯМЯ

ржЕржирзБрж╖рзНржарж╛ржирзЗрж░ ржХтАЩржжрж┐ржи ржЖржЧрзЗржЗ ржПржХ ржжрзБрж░рзНржШржЯржирж╛рзЯ ржПржХржЯрж┐ ржХржоржмрзЯрж╕рзА ржЫрзЗрж▓рзЗ ржЧрзБрж░рзБрждрж░ ржЖрж╣ржд рж╣рж▓ред ржкрж┐ржЬрж┐ рждрзЗ ржЪрж┐ржХрж┐рзОрж╕рж╛рж░ ржмрзНржпржмрж╕рзНржерж╛ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ ржЖржорж░рж╛ ржЫрж╛рждрзНрж░рж░рж╛ рж╕ржмрж╛ржЗ ржЖрж░ рж╢рж┐ржХрзНрж╖ржХржжрзЗрж░ржУ ржЕржирзЗржХрзЗ ржмрзНржпрж╕рзНржд рж░ржЗрж▓рж╛ржоред ржкрзНрж░ржержо ржжрзБтАЩ ржжрж┐ржи ржЕржмрж╕рзНржерж╛рж░ ржЙржирзНржирждрж┐ рж╣рж▓рзЗржУ ржЗржирзНржЯрж╛рж░ржирзНржпрж╛рж▓ рж╣рзЗржорж╛рж░рзЗржЬ рж╕рж╛ржорж▓рж╛рждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░рж▓рзЗржи ржирж╛ ржбрж╛ржХрзНрждрж╛рж░рзЗрж░рж╛ред рж╢рзЛржХ рж╕рж╛ржорж▓рзЗ ржЙржарзЗ ржЯрзЗрж░ ржкрзЗрж▓рж╛ржо ржЖржорж╛ржжрзЗрж░ рждрж╣ржмрж┐рж▓ ржерзЗржХрзЗ ржЕржирзЗржХржЯрж╛ржЗ ржЦрж░ржЪ рж╣рзЯрзЗ ржЧрзЗржЫрзЗ ржЪрж┐ржХрж┐рзОрж╕рж╛рж░ ржЦрж╛рждрзЗред ржЬрзЛржЧрж╛рзЬ ржХрж░рзЗ рж╕рж╛ржорж╛рж▓ ржжрзЗржмрж╛рж░ржУ рж╕ржорзЯ ржирзЗржЗред ржЕржирзБрж╖рзНржарж╛ржирзЗрж░ ржЬрж╛ржБржХржЬржоржХ ржЖржирзЗржХржЯрж╛ржЗ ржХржорж▓ред ржШрж╛ржЯрждрж┐ рж╕рж╛ржорж▓рж╛ржирзЛржЯрж╛ ржПржХржЯрж╛ ржжрзБржГрж╢рзНржЪрж┐ржирзНрждрж╛ рж╣рзЯрзЗ ржорж╛ржерж╛рзЯ рж░рзЯрзЗржЗ ржЧрзЗрж▓ред

ржЕржирзБрж╖рзНржарж╛ржирзЗрж░ ржжрж┐ржи рж╕рж╛рж░рж╛ржжрж┐ржиржЗ рж╖рзНржЯрзЗржЬ рж╕рж╛ржорж▓рж╛ржирзЛрзЯ ржмрзНржпрж╕рзНрждред рж╕ржирзНржзрзНржпрзЗрж░ ржкрж░ ржЦржмрж░ ржкрзЗрж▓рж╛ржо рж╢рж┐рж▓рзНржкрзА ржПрж╕рзЗ ржЧрзНржпрж╛ржЫрзЗржи рж╕рзНрждрзНрж░рзА ржУ ржХржирзНржпрж╛ржХрзЗ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ, рж╕рзЗржХрзНрж░рзЗржЯрж╛рж░рзА ржорж╢рж╛ржЗ ржУ рж╕ржЩрзНржЧрзЗ ржЖржЫрзЗржиред ржирж┐ржЬрзЗ ржЧрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржЕржнрзНржпрж░рзНржержирж╛ ржХрж░рж╛ржЗ рж╣рзЯрждрзЛ ржЙржЪрж┐ржд рж╣рждред ржХрж┐ржирзНржд ржоржи ржерзЗржХрзЗ ржПрждржЯрж╛ рждрж╛ржЧрж┐ржж ржПрж▓рзЛ ржирж╛ред ржжрзЗржЦрж╛ рждрзЛ рж╣ржмрзЗржЗред 
ржХрж┐ржЫрзБржХрзНрж╖ржг ржкрж░рзЗржЗ ржЖржмрж╢рзНржп рж╢рж┐рж▓рзНржкрзА ржирж┐ржЬрзЗржЗ ржбрзЗржХрзЗ ржкрж╛ржарж╛рж▓рзЗржиред ржПржХрзЗржмрж╛рж░рзЗ ржЬрж░рзБрж░рзА рждрж▓ржмред ржЪрж┐ржирзНрждрж╛

[30/10/2018, 21:38:05] тАк+91┬а94322┬а49285тАм: *UNIQUE VILLAGES IN INDIA:* 

*01. SHANI SHIGNAPUR, Maharashtra.*
In the entire Village all Houses are without Doors. Even No Police Station. No Thefts.
*02. SHETPHAL, Maharashtra.*
Villagers have SNAKES in every family as their members. 
*03. HIWARE BAZAR, Maharashtra.*
Richest Village in India. 60 Millionaires. No one is poor and highest GDP.
*04. PUNSARI, Gujrat.* 
Most modern Village. All Houses with CCTV & WI-FI. All street lights are Solar Powered.
*05. JAMBUR, Gujarat.*
All villagers look like Africans but are Indians. Nicknamed as African Village. 
*06. KULDHARA, Rajasthan.* 
Haunted village. No one lives there. All Houses are abandoned. 
*07. KODINHI, Kerela.* 
Village of TWINS. More than 400 Twins. 
*08. MATTUR, Karnataka.*
Village with 100% SANSKRIT speaking people in their normal day to day conversation. 
*09. BARWAAN KALA, Bihar.* 
Village of Bachelors. No marriage since last 50 years.
*10. MAWLYNNONG, Meghalaya.*
Cleanest village of Asia. Also with an amazing Balancing huge Rock on a tiny rock.
*11. RONGDOI, Assam.* 
As per Villagers beliefs, Frogs are married to get RAINS. 

Please post about uniqueness of any other places you know off.

[31/10/2018, 18:11:40] тАк+91┬а94322┬а49285тАм: I woke up today , having dreamt early morning at 4 AM . I was in the biggest DLF Mall of  India looking to buy a pair of socks and a neck tie .
As I walked in, I noticed a sweater with a price tag of RS 9000 .Next to the sweater were a pair of Jeans for Rs.10000 .The socks were Rs.8000 ! And Tie for estonishing 16,000 /-

I went looking for a salesperson and found one in the watch Dept

 He was showing a man a Rs. 225/- Rolex watch . I looked in the glass case and there was a 4 carat diamond ring also on sales for Rs.95/-

Shocked I asked the salesperson "How could a Rolex watch sell for Rs.225/- ? ,and a cheap pair of socks sell for Rs. 8000/-"? 

He said "Someone slid into the store last night and changed the price tag on everything ".

"Everyone is confused , people are acting like they have lost their sense of value". "They are willing to pay lots of money for things of little value ,and very little money for things of great value "

"Its like they don't know what is really valuable and what's not " . I hope we get the price tags back-on right soon ,I really pity , seeing people paying way too much for things of little value "

I woke up startled & confused and thinking since then ...

Maybe our life is like this dream.

Maybe someone slid into our lives and the changed the price on everything

 Maybe  they marked up the value of  competition, position, titles,  fame , promotion,  show-off , money and power !

...And put a huge discount on the value of *Happiness , Family , Relationships, Peace of mind , Contentment , Love , Knowledge , Kindness  , Friendships*...

 Maybe We are all living this dream...


*I hope...... we wake up, well in-time*

[03/11/2018, 11:12:43] тАк+91┬а98408┬а52380тАм: Check out these fantastic *Peruvian Shamanic Whistling Vessels!!* 
Jose Vitancio Umeres is an expert in pre-historic Peruvian wind/musical instruments. These are his reproductions of ancient originals.
Being made out of clay archeologists first thought they were regular water bottles or a type of toy until an amateur anthropologist apparently proved their ritual use. One can also just blow into the vessel but when water is added in one of the chambers and the vessel is rocked back and forth the shifting air creates an interesting sound pattern. Depending on the construction different animal sounds can be imitated.

A woman went for fishing. She eventually got tired so she sat, packed her fishing gear & started reading a book.

A Policeman came & said: Mam u r in "NO" fishing Zone.

She replied: "I am reading not fishing."

The policeman said: "But u have all equipment & u might start anytime."

The woman shouted back: "Im not fishing here and now u r sexually harassing me."

Shocked policeman replied: "I am not doing anything!"

She smiled: "You have all equipment & might start
anytime!"

----рж▓рзЗржЯ ржЖрж╕ ржкрж╛рж░рзНржЯ ржирж╛ржУ! 

***ржирж╛ржо ржХрж┐ рждрзЛржорж╛рж░?

----ржЖржЦрж▓рзЗрж╢ рж╕рж┐рж░ржХрж╛рж░

[11/11/2018, 21:42:36] тАк+91┬а98408┬а52380тАм: Sharing a very nice writeup about a visit to statue of unity

My parents' visit to Statue of Unity and the awesomeness of the project:

My parents being "my parents", they visited the Statue yesterday i.e. 3 days after inauguration. Mother conveyed this today morning, since you write, you need to know this aspect of the project. I heard and narrating it and hope this gets shared for this is just awesome - the effect on the locals.

The project has been pilloried by "liberals" for waste of money, evil RSS/BJP, Modi, Nehru sidelining, and some reports on locals not getting water but money spent on this project etc. My mother's observations just present the awesome picture of this project.

Firstly, the statue is awe inspiring, lot said about how it got built, history, material etc. Wide roads have been built to reach there and the entire complex has a feeling of "foreign tourist spot" (mum's words). 

Ticket is Rs. 500 pp and for extra 30 rupees, you can get the bus ride. Bus is modern and air conditioned and you can take it to get around the complex. There is a museum at the bottom , travelators, escalators and a lift that takes you to the viewing gallery which is at chest level of the statue which is 45 floors high. The Sardar Sarovar dam looks tiny from that height. 

Everything is "posh", neat and clean, great toilets etc. They also have a massive food court where food is non stop and great quality. Parents loved the entire trip and experience.

Now comes the awesome part. The entire staff working there is from the surrounding areas which were fairly poor and backward. The business are all run by local people and the complex will grow with more attractions coming on. There are young boys and girls who wear grey uniforms and work as "guides". These are from the very poor, farmer and tribal families. For the entire project, training centres have been set up to skill these people according to their interest and ability. The guides get 25K if they can speak only Gujarati, 35K if they can speak Hindi and 45K if they can also speak English. This is a Central government run place so they get sarkari jobs. Officers are constantly on the move identifying and training these folks for the different kinds of jobs.

The kids and other locals say we used to simply sit around till this project came around, we have now got jobs and amazing training as well as exposure to city people which has changed our worldview as well as life. Given us tremendous opportunities.

They are extremely happy with this project as it has transformed their lives, love Modi and cannot stop singing praises. My parents' guide was a young man who narrated all this to them, their bus driver was calling someone on mobile saying "Apply quickly for the job here and don't forget to bring your driving licence"...lot of opportunities and optimism.

People whose lands were taken for the project have been given alternative lands (cab driver my parents went with was one such) and pucca houses. One person got a land with big sinkhole which the government filled up.

There are two tent cities built on the river bank next to the statue and you can rent tents there. At night, laser shows are conducted which is a fabulous experience.

Finally, like here, you can pre book tickets online and go there so you don't need to stand in queues. All in all, a first world tourist spot created in record time apart from the greatness of the person being known to people now but also transformed so many local lives.

Well done PM and Gujarat government!!! Negative people can keep cribbing but work is work and quality is quality!!!

Abijit Kothiwale

[14/11/2018, 23:52:36] тАк+91┬а99033┬а87874тАм: Two students go to physics oral exam. The first goes in the class and the professor begins with the questions:

Lets say you are traveling by train and its getting hot. What will you do?

Open the window. he answers.

Very good! The professor continues

*The window has a surface of 1.5 m2, the compartment has a volume of 12 m3, the train speeds 80 km / h to the west, the south wind blowing at 5 m/s. How quickly will the space be refreshed?*

The student does not know the answer and fails the exam. He gets out and tells the other student the question he was asked. 

The second student  goes in, and the professor begins with the questions:

Lets say you are traveling by train and getting hot. What will you do?

Take off the coat - answers the student.

"It's very hot!" Continues the professor.

Take off my shirt and my vest.

It's very very hot!
Barks the Professor.

Will take off the pants and socks answers the student.

"What if someone comes and tries to rape you,"?  said the angry professor.

[17/11/2018, 8:24:31] тАк+82┬а10тАС2906тАС2583тАм: 4 Hormones which determine a human's happiness.

Dear friends ...
As I sat in the park after my morning walk, My wife came and slumped next to me. She had completed her 30-minute jog. We chatted for a while. She said she is not happy in life. I looked up at her sheer disbelief since she seemed to have the best of everything in life.
 "Why do you think so?" "I don't know. Everyone tells I have everything needed, but I am not happy."Then I questioned myself, am I happy?  "No," was my inner voice reply. Now, that was an eye-opener for me. I began my quest to understand the real cause of my unhappiness, I couldn't find one.

I dug deeper, read articles, spoke to life coaches but nothing made sense. At last my doctor friend gave me the answer which put all my questions and doubts to rest. I implemented those and will say I am a lot happier person.

She said there are four hormones which determine a human's happiness - 
1. Endorphins, 
2. Dopamine,
3. Serotonin, and 
4. Oxytocin.
It is important we understand these hormones, as we need all four of them to stay happy.

Let's look at the first hormone the Endorphins. When we exercise, the body releases Endorphins. This hormone helps the body cope with the pain of exercising. We then enjoy exercising because these Endorphins will make us happy. Laughter is another good way of generating Endorphins. We need to spend 30 minutes exercising every day, read or watch funny stuff to get our day's dose of Endorphins.

The second hormone is Dopamine. In our journey of life, we accomplish many little and big tasks, it releases various levels of Dopamine. When we get appreciated for our work at the office or at home, we feel accomplished and good, that is because it releases Dopamine. This also explains why most housewives are unhappy since they rarely get acknowledged or appreciated for their work. Once, we join work, we buy a car, a house, the latest gadgets, a new house so forth. In each instance, it releases Dopamine and we become happy. Now, do we realize why we become happy when we shop?

The third hormone Serotonin is released when we act in a way that benefits others. When we transcend ourselves and give back to others or to nature or to the society, it releases Serotonin. Even, providing useful information on the internet like writing information blogs, answering peoples questions on Quora or Facebook groups will generate Serotonin. That is because we will use our precious time to help other people via our answers or articles.

The final hormone is Oxytocin, is released when we become close to other human beings. When we hug our friends or family Oxytocin is released. The "Jadoo Ki Jhappi" from Munnabhai does really work. Similarly, when we shake hands or put our arms around someone's shoulders, various amounts of Oxytocin is released. 

So, it is simple, we have to exercise every day to get Endorphins, 
we have to accomplish little goals and get Dopamine, 
we need to be nice to others to get  Serotonin and 
finally hug our kids, friends, and families to get Oxytocin and we will be happy. When we are happy, we can deal with our challenges and problems better.

Now, we can understand why we need to hug a child who has a bad mood.

So to.make your child more and more happy day by day ...

1.Motivate him to play on the ground -Endorphins 

2. Appreciate your child for his small big achievements- Dopamine 

3.inculcate sharing habit through you to your child - Serotonin 

4. Hug your child -Oxytocin

Please share the valuable and essential for the current generation

[17/11/2018, 18:25:33] тАк+91┬а94322┬а49285тАм: *SINGAPORE AIRLINES -- GOOD ONE*

A mother and her young inquisitive son were flying Singapore Airlines from Singapore to New York.
The son (who had been looking out the window) turned to his mother and asked, 'If dogs have baby dogs and cats have baby cats, why don't planes have baby planes????

'The mother (who couldn't think of an answer) told her son to ask the pretty flight attendant.
So the boy dutifully asked the flight attendant, 'If dogs have baby dogs and cats have baby cats, why don't planes have baby planes?'

The flight attendant responded, 'Did your mother tell you to ask me that?'

The little boy admitted that she did. 

тАЬWell, then, tell your mother that there are no baby planes because Singapore Airlines always pulls out on time.

Now, let your mother explain that to you.!!!тАЭ

[18/11/2018, 14:38:53] Anupom Roy: That's the kind of involvement we all want. We would all love to participate in such discussions. 
As a start, let us first understand our objective.

It is not another reunion. It is our 25th year of passing out and we want it to be memorable enough in times to come.

It is not just another binge of eating and drinking. Obviously adda furti all will be there throughout the day. But we owe a lot to this institution and need to have a mind to give something back. 

And that is why this is not a committee. We formed a foundation which is beyond this event. It is conceived to be a platform to connect, help, sustain and upgrade fellow BEings in time to come and you are *the* person who can forge this.

Considering the sustainibility component, the amount initially asked for is miniscule... Already there are ladies and gentlemen coffering up with amounts to the tune of 25000/-.

Now there are several thoughts with this corpus. I believe your ideas are much important to this...

So let's do it in this way, during the start of this group Moumita gave a broader picture... If you missed that, we can repost it. But we all welcome suggestions... from one and all...

This is the least we can give back to our society as a part of our gratitude.

[18/11/2018, 16:28:41] тАк+91┬а98408┬а52380тАм: One day Paddy goes into a pharmacy - reaches into his pocket and takes out a small Irish whiskey bottle and a teaspoon.

He pours from the bottle onto the teaspoon and offers it to the pharmacist.

"Could you taste this for me, please?"

The pharmacist takes the teaspoon, puts it in his mouth, swills the liquid around and swallows it.

"Does that taste sweet to you?? asks the chap.
"No, not at all," says the chemist.

"Oh that's a relief," says Paddy. "The doctor told me to come here and get my urine tested for sugar by the pharmacist."

Requesting you in folded  hands ЁЯЩПЁЯЩПЁЯЩПЁЯЩПЁЯЩПЁЯЩП

They are getting demoralized. 

There are other 360 friends to facilitate your participation in the reunion and will heartily welcome you in the reunion.

Rs 7500  charge is less than one rupee per day in past 25 years.this will hardly meet the requirement of all cost including "giving back to college."

All the expenditures in the event will be published in the website after " audit" for everybody's satisfaction.

We need to work hard to raise funds thru several means to make this happen.

Please send us your T shirt size,adress  and family details along with your recent photograph so that we can register for you free of cost which will be borne by your other 360 well wishers happily who all welcome you in the reunion. 
See you there.

Swarup

Dear Swarup,
   Please do not feel sorry. I prefer personally to share opinions on public issues publicly and dislike one - one communication with individual group members to influence favourably.
    Number of groups have been formed across the world and declared, to collect fund - members know about it. 
     How many members know, which group took the decision to set minimum registration amount of Rs.7500/- ? 
    Any specifice reason as it was never discussed in the group platform ?
     What is the mystery behind "giving back to college" ? 
      Why we need to collect minimum amount of Rs.7500/- from individual member if '93 batch can plan to organize the same with Rs.3000/- ?
     As you have stated only few friends are working hard to make 25th Reunion happen, and I believe you are one of them, please take the initiative to clear the air.
    "Snehasis" has paid 7500/- to enjoy in Reunion. He has right to know whether entire amount to be spent for R├йunion or part of it to be spent to repair internal roads of the college. If you have any such hidden plan, please let the members know before collecting money in the name of Reunion.
    Finally, I request you with folded hands, please take major decisions democratically as much as possible and maintain extreme level of Transparency and Accountability towards dealing with public money.
   Brgds,
Prasenjit

[27/11/2018, 1:30:09] тАк+91┬а96771┬а27749тАм: Dear Friends,

Last couple of days we are discussing about the venue for our first meeting regarding our 25 years Reunion on 22-Dec-2018 Saturday.

Though it is nearly decided that we will be meeting at Raha's office. But tentative attendees as of now is 14+ (many friends are yet to respond) . So, I can propose some alternative arrangements to All of you as follows : -

Some favourable points: -

1. We can have our first meeting at our Kolkata office, which is at Sector V, Salt Lake.
2. We can accommodate 25+ friends.
3. We can have the projector facilities, if required.
4. No need not to pay location charges. 
5. From office, I can arrange Tea / Coffee, as required.

Some Disadvantages : -

1. Saturday our office is partially open and we need to close our meeting latest by 6:00pm (+30 minutes). Accordingly we can start by 3:00pm. 
2. We can't have Alcohol inside office premises.
3. We can't have cigarette (smoking) inside office premises.
4. Need to maintain office decorum as some people will be working in Office.
5. If we need to have some evening snacks, then we have to arrange by our own.

If my proposal is acceptable to you All, please let me know, so that I can arrange with our Office Administration and then confirm all of You.

[27/11/2018, 11:50:40] тАк+1┬а(770)┬а231тАС3130тАм: While participants for Dec 22, 2018  are being finalized тАУ we all know this is going to be the hot-topic for the proposed Kolkata meeting тАУ so let me propose the *Corporate Fund Raising Committee* -  probably the most important of all committees 
@917010584601 & @919999534470 are going to co-lead this subcommittee тАУ (for obvious focus on both public and private sectors!)

The core committee will be Prasanta Paul, Anirban (Moha) Majumdar, Plaban Chatterjee,. Barnali Ghosh, Santanu Das (Ghatu), Surajit Mitra, Lam Zhing, Souradeep Mitra, Prasenjit Dutta Roy; Debananda Mahapatra (Gudum); santanu Chatterjee (Panchu), Biplab Mahapatra, Hyacinth Lyngdoh;

Any more volunteers with contacts --- please egiye esho тАУ nijera kom khosate chaile, ekhane prochur help lagbe bhai!

FYI - The rough draft budget of our 3-part program is almost a crore (45 Lakhs for Day 1 In-college, 20 Lakhs for Out-of-college and 35 lakhs of Give-back). The funds are expected to come from (a) Alumni Registration for In-college Reunion тАУ 20 Lakhs, (b) Alumni contributions for Out-of-college Reunion тАУ 10 Lakhs, (c) Alumni Optional give-back contributions тАУ 5 Lakhs and the balance (d) 65 Lakhs from Advertisement/Corporate Sponsorships.

So Aamader alumnider contribution-e kichuta furti, kichuta memoir mementos and optional give back тАУ baki program will primarily rely on advertisement and corporate funds --- tai ei committee tar dayitto is most!! If we do not have enough funds, we will have to curtail back on budget from (a) mementos for in-college reunion, (b) elements of fun from out-of-college reunion and (c) give-back portion. The  Corporate Fund Raising Committee  along with the Logistics Committee (volunteer announcement to follow) will be presenting the details on Dec 22, 2018 and then will be refining the above strategy/budget based on inputs from the  first face-to-face meeting in Kolkata on Dec 22nd 2018.

Otoeb jonogon esho Ei meeting e aar boktobbo rakho...aar volunteer koro pls...three cheers for our reunion ЁЯШН

[28/11/2018, 1:56:39] тАк+91┬а99995┬а34470тАм: *Boeing* produces over 40 nos  (FORTY) 737 airplanes a month. 
A train arrives with the main body early in the morning.  
They assemble *one aircraft every 18* hours - from the time the first base is laid & bolt put in, on a conveyor that is 3┬╜  miles long, to the time it takes off for testing - it's 18 hrs.. . 

Very soon, the target is to build 60 every month..

Difficult to imagine how quality is maintained.
Must be a logistical nightmare, balancing & maintaining every spare, every item, every part that goes into an aircraft.
On an average, 3 millions  parts are required for putting together an aeroplane.

*Hats off to Boeing.*

[03/12/2018, 23:47:36] тАк+1┬а(812)┬а900тАС3244тАм: EE-45
[03/12/2018, 23:54:13] тАк+91┬а99033┬а87874тАм: All married men will attest to some real wisdom in this message 
...
...In the world of romance, one single rule applies: 
MAKE YOUR WOMAN HAPPY! 

Do something she likes, and you get points. 
Do something she dislikes, and points are subtracted. 
You don't get any points for doing something she expects. 
Sorry, that's the way the game is played. 

Here is a non-exhaustive guide to the point system: 

SIMPLE DUTIES 
You make the bed. (+1) 
You make the bed, but forget the decorative pillows. (-10) 
You throw the bedspread over rumpled sheets. (-3) 
You go out to buy her what she wants (+5) in the rain (+8) 
But return with Old Monk. (-5) 

PROTECTIVE DUTIES 
You check out a suspicious noise at night. (+1) 
You check out a suspicious noise, and it is nothing. (0) 
You check out a suspicious noise, and it is something. (+5) 
You pummel it with an iron rod. (+10) 
It's her pet poodle . (-20) 

SOCIAL ENGAGEMENTS 
You stay by her side for the entire party. (+1) 
You stay by her side for a while, then leave to chat with an old school friend. (-2) 
Named Tina (-10) 
Tina is a dancer. (-10) 
Tina is single. (-40) 

HER BIRTHDAY 
You take her out to dinner. (+2) 
You take her out to dinner, and it's not a sports bar. (+3) 
Okay, it's a sports bar. (-2) 
And its all-you-can-eat night. (-3) 
It's a sports bar, it's all-you-can-eat night, and your face is painted the colors of your favorite team. (-10) 

A NIGHT OUT 
You take her to a movie. (+1) 
You take her to a movie she likes. (+5) 
You take her to a movie you hate. (+6) 
You take her to a movie you like. (-2) 
It's called 'Death Cop.' (-3) 
You lied and said it was a foreign film about orphans. (-15) 

YOUR PHYSIQUE 
You develop a noticeable potbelly. (-15) 
You develop a noticeable potbelly and exercise to get rid of it. (+10) 
You develop a noticeable potbelly and resort to baggy jeans and baggy Hawaiian shirts. (-30) 
You say, "It doesn't matter, you have one too." (-80) 

THE BIG QUESTION 
She asks, "Do I look fat?" (-5) 
(Yes, you lose points no matter what) 
You hesitate in responding. (-10) 
You reply, "Where?" (-35) 
You give any other response. (-20) 

COMMUNICATION 
When she wants to talk about a problem, you listen, displaying what looks like a concerned expression. (+2) 
You listen, for over 30 minutes (+50) 
You listen for more than 30 minutes without looking at the TV. (+500) 
She realizes this is because you have fallen asleep. (-4000) 

Send this on to all of the gentlemen you know to refresh them on the point system.
(and to the ladies you know with a good sense of humor!) !!!

[05/12/2018, 2:28:14] тАк+91┬а90515┬а27900тАм: ржПржХрзНржХрзЗржмрж╛рж░рзЗ рж░ржХрзНрждрж╛ржХрзНржд рж╕рж░рзАрж╕рзГржкЁЯдкред Jokes apart ржмрж╛ржЩрж▓рж╛ рж╕рж╛рж╣рж┐рждрзНржпрж░ рж╕рж╛ржерзЗ рждрзЛрж░ ржпрзЛржЧ ржПржЦржиржУ ржЕржЯрзБржЯ

ржЦрж┐ржжрзЗ ржкрзЗрзЯрзЗ ржЧрзЗрж▓ ЁЯШД
[05/12/2018, 2:38:24] тАк+1┬а(414)┬а502тАС6479тАм: Ami prai 20 bochor kono legit bengalu biye khai na...at kolkata
[05/12/2018, 2:38:34] тАк+1┬а(414)┬а502тАС6479тАм: Very frustrating
[05/12/2018, 2:49:42] тАк+91┬а96196┬а94165тАм: Hilarious take on how 'budget airlines' charge, and what happens when it is given back to them !!!! 

Spare a thought for poor Rahul Bhatia, Chief Executive of Indigo.
After arriving in a hotel in Mumbai, he went to the bar and asked for a pint of Guinness. 

The barman nodded and said, "That will be тВ╣50 please, Mr. Bhatia." 

Somewhat taken aback, Rahul replied, "That's very cheap," and handed over his money.

"Well, we do try to stay ahead of the competition", said the barman. "And we are serving free pints every Wednesday from 6pm until 8pm. We have the cheapest beer in Mumbai".

"That is remarkable value", Rahul comments.

"I see you don't seem to have a glass, so you'll probably need one of ours. That will be тВ╣150 please." 

Rahul scowled, but paid up. 

He took his drink and walked towards a seat. "Ah, you want to sit down?" said the barman. "That'll be an extra тВ╣150. You could have pre-booked the seat, and it would have only cost you тВ╣100."

"I think you may to be too big for the seat sir, can I ask you to sit in this frame please". 

Rahul attempts to sit down but the frame is too small and when he can't squeeze in he complains "Nobody would fit in that little frame". 
"I'm afraid if you can't fit in the frame you'll have to pay an extra surcharge of тВ╣250 for your seat sir". 
Rahul swore to himself, but paid up.

"I see that you have brought your laptop with you" added the barman. "And since that wasn't pre-booked either, that will be another тВ╣300." 

Rahul was so incensed that he walked back to the bar, slammed his drink on the counter, and yelled, "This is ridiculous, I want to speak to the manager". 
"I see you want to use the counter," says the barman, "that will be тВ╣200 please." 

Rahul's face was red with rage. "Do you know who I am?" 
"Of course I do Mr. Bhatia." 

"I've had enough! What sort of Hotel is this? I come in for a quiet drink and you treat me like this. I insist on speaking to a manager!"

"Here is his E-mail address, or if you wish, you can contact him between 9.00am and 9.01am every morning, Monday to Tuesday at this free phone number. Calls are free, until they are answered, then there is a talking charge of only тВ╣10 per second, or part thereof".

"I will never use this bar again".

"OK sir, but remember, we are the only star hotel in Mumbai selling pints for тВ╣50.
        ЁЯЩИЁЯдб

ржЪрж╛рж░ ржорж╛рж╕ ржкрж░ ржбрж┐ржЖржЗржЬрж┐ рж╕рж╛рж╣рзЗржм ржкрзЬрж╛рж░ рж░рзБржорзЗ ржПрж▓рзЗржиред ржПрждржжрж┐ржи рждрж╛ржХрзЗ ржПржХржмрж╛рж░ржУ ржжрзЗржЦрж┐ржирж┐, ржмрзЗрж╢ ржЧржорзНржнрзАрж░ ржЪрзЗрж╣рж╛рж░рж╛, ржжрзЗржЦрж▓рзЗ рж╕ржорзАрж╣ ржЖрж╕рзЗред ржЪрзЛржЦрзЗрж░ ржЪрж╢ржорж╛рзЯ, ржжрж╛ржоржЯрж╛ ржкрзБрж▓рж┐рж╢рзЗрж░ ржкрзЛрж╢рж╛ржХрзЗрж░ ржорждрзЛ ржЭрж┐рж▓рж┐ржХ ржорж╛рж░ржЫрзЗ, рж╣рж╛рждрзЗрж░ ржШрзЬрж┐рждрзЗ ржЖрж░ржУ ржмрзЗрж╢рж┐редрждрж┐ржирж┐ ржЕржирж┐рж░ ржПржХржЯрж┐ ржЦрж╛рждрж╛ рж╣рж╛рждрзЗ рждрзБрж▓рзЗ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ ржжрзЗржЦрждрзЗ ржжрзЗржЦрждрзЗ ржмрж▓рж▓рзЗржи, ржорж╛рж╕рзНржЯрж╛рж░, ржЖржкржирж╛рж░ ржорж╛ржЗржирзЗ ржЪрж╛рж░рж╢ ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛ ржмрж╛рзЬрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржжрж┐рж▓рж╛ржоред
- ржХрзЗржи рж╕рзНржпрж╛рж░?
- ржЖржорж░рж╛ ржкрзБрж▓рж┐рж╢рзЗрж░ рж▓рзЛржХред ржЧрзБржгрзАрж░ ржХржжрж░ ржХрж░рждрзЗ ржЬрж╛ржирж┐ред ржП ржкрж░рзНржпржирзНржд ржХрзЛржирзЛ ржорж╛рж╕рзНржЯрж╛рж░ ржЖржорж╛рж░ ржЫрзЗрж▓рзЗрж░ ржХрж╛ржЫрзЗ ржжрзБржЗ ржорж╛рж╕рзЗрж░ ржмрзЗрж╢рж┐   ржЯрзЗржХрзЗржирж┐ред ржкрзНрж░рждрзНржпрзЗржХрзЗ ржЖржорж╛рж░ ржЫрзЗрж▓рзЗржХрзЗ ржмржХрж╛ ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗржЫрзЗ, ржорзЗрж░рзЗржЫрзЗ, ржЕрж╢рзНрж░рж╛ржмрзНржп ржХржерж╛ ржмрж▓рзЗржЫрзЗред ржЫрзЗрж▓рзЗ ржХрзЗржмрж▓ ржЖржкржирж╛рж░ржЗ ржкрзНрж░рж╢ржВрж╕рж╛ ржХрж░рзЗржЫрзЗред ржЖржкржирж┐ ржирж╛ржХрж┐  ржнрж╛рж▓рзЛ ржкрзЬрж╛ржиред
рждрж┐ржирж┐ ржПржХржЯрж╛ ржХрж▓ржо ржУ ржПржХржЯрж╛ ржбрж╛рзЯрзЗрж░рж┐ ржЖржорж╛рж░ рж╣рж╛рждрзЗ ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗ ржмрж▓рзЗржи, ржПржЧрзБрж▓рзЛрж░ ржЖржкржирж╛рж░ред
- ржерзНржпрж╛ржВржХ ржЗржЙ рж╕рзНржпрж╛рж░ред

- рждрзБржорж┐ ржХрзА ржХрж▓ржо ржЖрж░ ржбрж╛рзЯрзЗрж░рж┐ рж╣рждрзЗржУ ржнрж╛ржЧ ржЪрж╛ржЗржЫ?

-  рждржмрзЗ?
-  ржЖржорж╛рж░ ржкрж╛ржУржирж╛ ржПржЦржи ржЪрж╛рж░рж╢ ржЖрж╢рж┐ ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛ред ржЖржорж┐ ржЖрж╢рж┐ ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛ ржирзЗржм ржирж╛, ржПржХрж╢ ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛ ржирзЗржмред рждрж╛рж░ ржорж╛ржирзЗ ржкрж╛ржБржЪрж╢ ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛ред
-  ржарж┐ржХ ржЖржЫрзЗред рждрзБржорж┐ ржЖржорж╛рж░ ржЯрж┐ржЪрж╛рж░, рждрзЛржорж╛ржХрзЗ  ржХрзБрзЬрж┐ ржЯрж╛ржХрж╛ ржмрзЗрж╢рж┐ ржжрж┐рждрзЗ ржирж╛ ржкрж╛рж░рж▓рзЗ ржЖржорж╛рж░ ржЬрзНржЮрж╛ржи ржЕрж░рзНржЬржи рж╣ржмрзЗ ржХрзАржнрж╛ржмрзЗ?

- ржХрзА ржХрж╛ржЬ?

- ржХрзА рж▓рж┐ржЦржм?

ржЕржирзЗржХ ржЪрж┐ржирзНрждрж╛ржнрж╛ржмржирж╛ ржХрж░рзЗ ржЕржирж┐рж░ ржмрж╛ржирзНржзржмрзАржХрзЗ ржжрзЗржУрзЯрж╛рж░ ржЬржирзНржп ржПржХржЯрж╛ ржЪрж┐ржарж┐ рж▓рж┐ржЦрж┐ред

-
ржпрждржЗ ржЧрж▓рзНржк ржХрж░рж┐, ржпрждржЗ ржкрзНрж░рзЗржоржкрждрзНрж░ рж▓рж┐ржЦрзЗ ржжрж┐ржЗ ржирж╛ ржХрзЗржи, рж▓рзЗржЦрж╛ржкрзЬрж╛рзЯ ржЕржирж┐ржХрзЗ ржПржоржи ржХрзМрж╢рж▓рзЗ ржмрзНржпрж╕рзНржд рж░рж╛ржЦрж┐ ржпрзЗ, рж╕рзЗ ржзрзАрж░рзЗ ржзрзАрж░рзЗ ржмржЗрзЯрзЗ ржЭрзБржБржХрзЗ ржкрзЬрзЗ, рждрж╛рж░ рж╕ржм ржЖржиржирзНржж ржЕржирзНржпрж╛ржирзНржп ржЬрж╛рзЯржЧрж╛ ржерзЗржХрзЗ ржмржЗрзЯрзЗрж░ ржкрж╛рждрж╛рзЯ ржПрж╕рзЗ ржнрзАрзЬ ржХрж░рждрзЗ рж╢рзБрж░рзБ ржХрж░рзЗред ржЖржЧрзЗ рждрж╛рж░ ржмрж╛ржмрж╛ржХрзЗ ржмрж▓ржд ржЪржХрж▓рзЗржЯрзЗрж░ ржХржерж╛, ржПржЦржи ржмрж▓рзЗ ржмржЗрзЯрзЗрж░ ржХржерж╛ред ржЖржЧрзЗ ржЗрж▓рзЗржХржЯрзНрж░ржирж┐ржХрзНрж╕ ржЬрж┐ржирж┐рж╕рзЗ рждрж╛рж░ ржЖрж▓ржорж╛рж░рж┐ ржЫрж┐рж▓ ржнрж░рзНрждрж┐; ржПржЦржи рж╕рзЗржЦрж╛ржирзЗ ржарж╛ржБржЗ ржкрзЗрзЯрзЗржЫрзЗ ржмржЗ, ржкрзГржерж┐ржмрзАрж░ ржмрж┐ржЦрзНржпрж╛ржд рж▓рзЗржЦржХржжрзЗрж░ ржирж╛ржирж╛ ржмржЗред ржЖржорж╛рж░ ржХрж╛ржЫ ржерзЗржХрзЗ ржирж╛ржо ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ ржпрж╛рзЯ ржмржЗрзЯрзЗрж░, ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ ржЖрж╕рзЗ рждрж╛рж░ ржмрж╛ржмрж╛ржХрзЗ ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗред ржжрзЗрж╢рзЗ ржирж╛ ржкрзЗрж▓рзЗ ржмрж┐ржжрзЗрж╢ ржерзЗржХрзЗред ржХржд ржжрж╛ржорж┐ ржжрж╛ржорж┐ ржмржЗ, ржЖржорж╛рж░ ржХрж╛ржЫрзЗ ржоржирзЗ рж╣рждрзЛ, рж╕рж╛ржорж░рзНржерзНржпржмрж╛ржиржжрзЗрж░ ржЗржЪрзНржЫрж╛ржЗ ржкрзНрж░рж╛ржкрзНрждрж┐ред
